loans.name: Felipe Ignacio

texts.en:
Felipe is 21 years old and his dream is to become a nurse. 

He is the younger brother of a family of three siblings.He is an excellent student who studied under scholarship at school because her family has very limited resources. His father works in the kitchen at a restaurant and his mother was a housekeeper who unfortunately is currently unemployed. He is the first in his family to attend college, and managed to do so with the help of his mother and state loans to finance the first two years of his career.

For him to finish a career in nursing is very important. Not only to financially help his family and have a better future, but also because he believes that public health can help improve the quality of life of people.
Felipe needs a loan to pay for tuition to fulfill his dream.

loans.use: Helps Felipe to pay for his education

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
Gloria is 37 years old and lives in Eastern Pob., Lopez Jaena, Misamis Occidental. She is married with three children.

Gloria catches and sells fish for a living and has been doing this for 17 years. She has requested a loan to purchase fishing materials. She has been a member of PMPC for seven years.

In the future, Gloria hopes to have enough savings for her family's future.

loans.use: to purchase fishing materials.

location.town: Plaridel-Eastern Pob., Lopez Jaena, Misamis Occide

loans.name: Victoriana

texts.en:
Victoriana is 59 years old and lives in Bato, Plaridel, Misamis Occidental. She is married with two children.

Victoriana has a grocery store. She has had this business for 13 years. She requested a loan to purchase four gallons of cooking oil, a sack of sugar, a sack of salt, assorted biscuits and candies.

Victoriana has been a member of PMPC for 13 years. In the future, Victoriana hopes to have enough savings for her family's future.

loans.use: to purchase four gallons of cooking oil, a sack of sugar, a sack of salt, assorted biscuits and candies.

loans.name: Marisa

texts.en:
Marisa is married with 4 children. Marisa is 44 years old and lives in Mamanga Gamay, Plaridel, Misamis Occidental, Philippines.

Marisa is a farmer and manages a rice farm to earn a living. She has been doing this for four years. She has requested a loan to purchase farm inputs like fertilizers and pesticide.

Marisa has been a member of PMPC for five years. In the future, Marisa hopes to have enough savings for her family's future.

loans.use: to purchase farm inputs like fertilizers and pesticide.

loans.name: Milva

texts.en:
Milva is 34 years old and lives in Unidos, Plaridel, Misamis Occidental. She is married with three children.

Milva has a motorcycle and earns approximately 6,000 PHP each month doing this type of work. She requested a loan to purchase motorcycle parts.

Milva has been a member of PMPC for nine years. In the future, Milva hopes to have enough savings for her family's future.

loans.use: to purchase motorcycle parts.

loans.name: Batzaya

texts.en:
Borrower Ms. Batzaya is a married lady who lives with her husband and son in a ger, a traditional Mongolian felt tent. She supports her family by operating a home supplies stall business at the local indoor market of Ulaanbaatar city. 

Batzaya is a very ambitious lady who desires to build a new house in her yard, so she is requesting a 3,000,000 MNT loan to purchase necessary construction materials. Her aim is to finish her house and live with her family happily.

loans.use: to build a house during this warm season

loans.name: Bayarjargal

texts.en:
Bayarjargal is a 36-year-old married woman who has two daughters. She lives with her family in an outer ger district that lacks the basic infrastructure of central Ulaanbaatar City, Mongolia. She works as a tester while her spouse runs a taxi service; both of their daughters attend local secondary schools. 

Bayarjargal is requesting a 3,000,000 MNT loan to purchase construction materials in order to finish renovation work on her family’s current house, which is old, unsafe, and small. Also, she will use the loan to build a garage to protect her car from the very cold winter season, which is very bad for cars.

loans.use: to buy construction materials to finish her home renovation.

loans.name: Odmaa

texts.en:
Borrower Ms. Odmaa is a 35-year-old woman who lives with her mother and younger sister in her sister's yard. She supports her family by operating a phone-selling stall business. She has one daughter who attends secondary school. She sells cell phones, phone headsets, chargers, and other phone accessories and supplies. 

She is requesting a loan in the amount of 2,500,000 MNT to purchase more headsets, chargers, and phones to sell in order to increase her working capital. She is a very active lady who desires to live successfully.

loans.use: to purchase more cell phones to sell in order to increase her working capital

loans.name: Muvulo

texts.en: Muthui is now applying for a KES 26,500 loan that will be used to purchase a 1500 litre tank for water harvesting during the rainy season. The project will benefit 4 family members and will take 2 weeks to complete.

loans.use: To purchase a water tank

loans.name: Russell

texts.en:
Russell has always been an entrepreneur at heart. After leaving the military, this veteran waited for the right opportunity to launch out and start his own business. When the housing market crashed in 2007, the number of bank-owned properties sky-rocketed, creating a large need for property preservation and maintenance. Seeing the opportunity in the market, Russell started R/M Asset Maintenance, a company which conducts foreclosure property maintenance, lawn care, clean-up and removal, as well as assisting with evictions and lock changes.  

With over a decade of experience in the construction, maintenance and janitorial industries, Russell already has the skills necessary to offer high quality, efficient service to his clients. Furthermore, his military training has instilled in him the discipline and work ethic to do whatever it takes to turn his business into a successful venture. 

Russell will use his $4,000 Kiva loan to purchase a truck, power generator and several power tools. This will provide him with the basic equipment necessary to get his business off the ground.

Russell's dreams of self-employment is slowly becoming a reality.  Currently, Russell is working full-time for a temp agency, but hopes to grow his company to the point where he can commit to it full time.

loans.use: to purchase a truck, power generator and several power tools

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en:
Nancy is a married lady, age 27, supporting a family of five members. She owns a motorcycle and transports people and goods; this is where her income comes from. She has been in operation for a period of four years, earning an income of 20,000 Kenyan shillings (KES).

Nancy is now servicing her second loan of 80,000 KES from KADET Ltd. and intends to use this loan to purchase a new motorbike. The anticipated loan will be used to purchase stock of cereals for resale. Her dream is to be successful in her business and live happily with her family.

loans.use: To purchase a new motorbike

loans.name: Fatmir

texts.en:
Fatmir is a married father of two young children, eight and one year old. The loan that he is requesting for the first time is an amount of 150,000 Albanian Lek; he wants to buy fodder for the animals with it. He and his family live in rural south central Albania and the only activity he has been involved in, has been livestock and a little bit of planting/selling veggies to the local market.

Fatmir’s income hasn’t been at the level where it should be, and being selected as a beneficiary of the integrated loans, he is thrilled. He hopes that their living conditions will improve and his children’s life will be better soon.

loans.use: To buy fodder for the animals

loans.name: Bold

texts.en:
Borrower Mr. Bold is a 32-year-old married man and he lives with his family in Darkhan city, Mongolia. He has three children ages 1 to 9 years.  The elder two of them are attending secondary school while the younger son stays at home. Bold works as a seller and driver at a local trade company and his wife works as a receptionist. 

The family lives in an old house which needs renovation work. Since the floor sinks and the exterior section of his house has become so old, he is requesting a 3,000,000 MNT loan to renovate his house by doing this housing project.

loans.use: to purchase necessary construction materials

loans.name: Angelina

texts.en: Anglina is 30 years old and she is  married. She has a motorcycle to generate income for her family. She is requesting her second loan from TRM (Tuba Rai Metin) for $1,000,to improving her business for the future.She is thinking happy because offered loan to her to improve her living condition.

loans.use: To buy a motorcycle

loans.name: Davaajargal

texts.en:
Borrower Davaajargal is 23 years old single lady who lives with her parents, sister and brother in Darkhan city, Mongolia. Since 2010 she has been operating vegetable stall business with her mother and sister at local market if the city. She has 6.000.000 MNT in working capital and now its the great possible time to increase her working capital. 

Davaajargal is requesting a 3.000.000 MNT loan to purchase more vegetables and products to sell. She is very hardworking young lady who really likes to making her busy.

loans.use: to purchase more goods to sell

loans.name: Davaakhuu

texts.en:
Borrower Davaakhuu is 43 years old married man who lives with his wife in Darkhan city, Mongolia. He is specialized in torch and electric welding. He makes torching and plaster working with his wife. The house that the family currently lives locates in a boggy place so it sinks in some exterior section. 

For this reason he really needs to make housing project for his house, so he is requesting a 3.000.000 MNT loan to purchase housing materials to finish his housing project and renovate his house.

loans.use: to buy housing materials and to finish housing project.

loans.name: Munkhbat

texts.en:
Borrower Munkhbat is 38 years old married woman and lives with his family in Darkhan city, Mongolia. She has three children and all of them are attend high, secondary school. She supports her family by operating fast food with special help with her spouse and children. 

She is requesting a 1.000.000 MNT loan to purchase food products to make fast food and to sell.

loans.use: to purchase food products in order to make meals and to sell

loans.name: Bat-Ochir

texts.en:
Borrower Mr.Bat-Ochir is 34 years old married man who has four children and lives with his family in Darkhan city, Mongolia. His elder three children attend secondary school other one stays at home. He is a machinist at local company and besides his current job he has been operating farming business since 2000, he has been planting tomatoes and other few kind of vegetables. 

He is requesting a 2.000.000 MNT loan to purchase few kind of vegetable seeds to plant. He is a very hardworking man who really overjoy his farming business.

loans.use: to purchase a few kind of seeds to farm.

loans.name: Battur

texts.en:
Borrower Battur is 36 years old married man and lives with his wife and two children in Darkhan city, Mongolia. He lives with his family in outer ger district of the city, currently he has one house at his yard and now he is preparing to build one more house. 

Thus he is requesting a 2.000.000 MNT loan to purchase construction materials which he really needs. In the future he will live with his family in new house and his relatives from countryside will live in an old house.

loans.use: to build new house at his landport

loans.name: Amarsanaa

texts.en:
Borrower Mr.Amarsanaa is 40 years old married man, he has five children and all of them are attend secondary school. He lives with his big family in Darkhan city of Mongolia. He makes torching by himself and his family owns their pig husbandry, usually his wife operates their pig husbandry.  Borrower's long term aim is to enlarge his husbandry, thus he need to make some housing work in order to build a garage and renovate his house.

So he is requesting a 3.000.000 MNT loan to purchase necessary housing materials to finish his housing project.

loans.use: to finish his house and garage

loans.name: Purevzul

texts.en:
Borrower Purevzul is 33 years old married woman lives with her family in Darkhan city of Mongolia. She has two children and both of them attend secondary school. She supports her family by operating clothing stall business at local market of the city. Now she sells children clothes and some home furniture. 

Now she really wants to increase her working capital through Kiva loan and she is requesting a 3.000.000 MNT loan to purchase modern fashionable clothes for upcoming season.

loans.use: to purchase more fashionable clothes to sell.

loans.name: Bayasmaa

texts.en:
Borrower Bayasmaa is 34 years old married woman and she lives with her family in Darkhan city, Mongolia. She has one son who attends primary school. She specialized in Eco-tourism manager but now she operates honeyed cosmetic goods stall business at local market. 

She was distributed this goods first time with her sister in Darkhan city, and now she has constant customers and has own market. She is requesting a 2.000.000 MNT loan to purchase more honeyed goods to sell at her stall.

loans.use: to purchase more honeyed cosmetic goods to sell

loans.name: Niyingabiye Group

texts.fr:
Daniel  fait partie du groupe  Niyingabiye  et   habite à Gitega. Il a 63  ans et est marié  à Angèle, une cultivatrice. Ensemble ils ont 3 enfants, tous étudient.

Il fait le commerce de  bière de banane  depuis  27 ans. 

Il est à son onzième  crédit à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’il  obtient, il  va  augmenter son capital et acheter  une grande quantité  de bière de banane   à revendre, pour gagner plus. 

Avec le gain de son commerce, il parvient à payer les frais scolaires des ses enfants, les soins de santé et à acheter les habits.En plus,Il a déjà acheté une parcelle pour ses enfants.
texts.en:
Daniel is a member of the Niyingabiye group and lives in Gitega. He is 63 years old and is married to Angèle, a farmer. Together, they have three children, who all go to school. 

Daniel has been selling banana beer for 27 years. He is on his 11th loan with Turame. With this loan, he is going to increase his capital and buy a large quantity of banana beer to resell, and earn more. 

With the earnings from this business, he manages to pay his children's school fees, their healthcare needs, and buy clothes. In addition, he already has bought a piece of land for his children.

loans.use: to buy many cans of banana beer to resell

loans.name: Amgalanbaatar

texts.en:
Borrower Amgalanbaatar is 30 years old married man who lives with his family in Darkhan city, Mongolia. He has three children, two of them attend attend kindergarten and elder daughter attends primary school while his wife operates kitchen. He supports his family by operating transportation business /runs for a taxi/.  

He is requesting a 1.000.000 MNT loan to purchase spare to make necessary auto repair work for his car. When he finish his repair work he can earn money and increase family income.

loans.use: to purchase some auto spare to make some repair work for his car

loans.name: Chimeddorj

texts.en: Borrower Chimeddorj is 25 years old guy who lives with his two brothers in Darkhan city, Mongolia. He works in a local transportation company and he also he is preparing to marry. So he must to prepare his living condition, thus he is requesting a 2.000.000 MNT loan to purchase necessary construction materials to build a house for him and live there with his future wife.

loans.use: to buy housing materials since he is preparing to marry

loans.name: Ulambayar

texts.en: Borrower Ulambayar is 29 years old married man who lives with his wife and daughter in Darkhan city, Mongolia. He is a driver and works in a local company while his wife stays at home babysits for their daughter. He lives in an apartment and he started to make some renovation work since his apartment became so old. So he is requesting a 1.000.000 MNT loan to finish his housing work

loans.use: to finish his housing work

loans.name: Nyamjav

texts.en:
Borrower Nyamjav is 49 years old widow who lives in Darkhan city, Mongolia. She has three children and two of them are married now she lives with her one daughter. She has been operating used clothes stall business. She has  2.600.000 MNT in working capital, mostly she purchases her clothes from Ulaanbaatar city. 

She is requesting a 1.500.000 MNT loan to purchase more clothes to sell in order to increase her working capital.

loans.use: to purchse more used clothes to sell

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret  is a married woman. She has four children with ages ranging from 14 years to 20 years. She describes herself as a strong, optimistic and courageous woman. She operates a grocery store where she sells vegetables and fruit. She has been involved in this business for 12 years. Her business is located within a residential area and her primary customers are local residents. She describes her biggest business challenge to be lack of permanent business premises to operate her business from. 

Margaret will use the Kes 20,000 loan to purchase chicken, tomatoes and vegetables for her green grocery. Her business goal is to improve her business  within 5 years. She hopes that in the future, she will buy a plot of land for her family and build a house. This is her second loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to purchase chicken, tomatoes and vegetables for her greengrocery.

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en:
Samuel is a single man. He has one child. He describes himself as determined. He operates a butchery where he sells meat. He has been involved in this business for six years. His business is located in a populated area and his primary customers are local residents. He describes his biggest business challenge to be lack of funds. 

He will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy meat to sell. His business goal is to have multiple outlets within five years. This is his first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy more meat to sell.

loans.name: Odbayar

texts.en:
Borrower Odbayar is 39 years old married man who lives with his family in Darkhan city, Mongolia. He has three children elder daughter attends institute and other two attend high school. The family lives in a house and their house became so old and unsafe.

Thus he needs to make housing project, so he is requesting a 2.000.000 MNT loan to purchase housing materials to renovate his current house. He said: "Don't be scared if u can do it", it shows that he is very brave and hardworking person.

loans.use: to purchase necessary housing materials

loans.name: Bayarsaikhan

texts.en:
Borrower Bayarsaikhan is 45 years old married, very hardworking man and he lives with his wife in Darkhan city, Mongolia. He has two children both of them are married and live in Ulaanbaatar city. He operates cow husbandry and also besides his husbandry he supports his family by operating breeze block manufacturing business. 

He sell his done breeze blocks to Darkhan's citizens and they really overjoy for his work. By his breeze block mostly of Darkhan city's families are making fence and building houses. He is requesting a 2.000.000 MNT loan to purchase more cements and other useful raw materials to make more breeze blocks to sell.

loans.use: to manufacture breezeblock and to sell

loans.name: Narantsetseg

texts.en:
Narantsetseg is 42 years old, married, and has two children.  She lives in Ulaanbaatar, Mongolia's capital. Her family lives in a ger, a traditional nomadic tent, in the city's outer district. Her husband works as a guard in a local shop.

Narantsetseg supports her family by running a shop that sells books and magazines in the town's largest indoor market. When she first began her business in 2003, she had 2,000,000 tugriks (MNT) in working capital. Now she has 12,500,000 MNT and sells pre-paid phone cards as well as books, magazines, and newspapers. 

Narantsetseg is requesting her fourth loan from Transcapital Co. Ltd. for 4,200,000 MNT, which she will use to buy more items to sell to her customers. Her goal for next year is to improve her business by expanding her stall and increasing her working capital, which will help her attract more customers.

loans.use: to purchase more items to sell in her bookstore.

loans.name: Alimaa

texts.en:
Borrower Alimaa is 25 years old married young lady who has one daughter and lives with her spouse and daughter in her parents-in-law's yard which locates in outer ger district of Ulaanbaatar city, Mongolia. She works at local communication company and besides her job she supports her family by operating small food kiosk business. She has one employer who works as a seller at her kiosk.

She is requesting a 2.500.000 MNT loan to travel to Shanghai with her spouse. Her spouse works as a driver in local company. They decided to travel during their vacation so Alimaa applied Kiva loan.

loans.use: to purchase more goods to sell

loans.name: Yanjmaa

texts.en:
Borrower Ms.Yanjmaa is 54 years old widow, she lives with her son in Ulaanbaatar city, Mongolia. Her son is 24 years old works as a salvation at the State of Emergency while borrower Yanjmaa works as a servant-woman at local police station.  

Yanjmaa lives with her son in an old house which really needs some renovation such as during the winter season her house became so cold and during the summer rainy season the house's roof is became unsafe. Thus she is requesting a 3.000.000 MNT loan to purchase necessary housing materials to make housing project. After this housing project she can live happily with her son.

loans.use: to make housing project for her current house.

loans.name: Efua

texts.en:
Although she has received no formal education, Efua is an entrepreneur. She specializes in selling kitchen utensils in Brasi (near Cape Coast). She has been involved in this enterprise for six years.

Efua is married and has no children. Her husband works as a mason. The proceeds from her business normally go towards helping her husband cover the family’s general expenses. 

Efua will use the loan to purchase increased amounts of utensils, thus aiding her to improve her overall sales. With the new profits from her expanded business, Efua plans to further diversify the types of products that she sells, hence adapting to changing customer preferences.

loans.use: to purchase increased amounts of utensils, thus aiding her to improve her overall sales.

loans.name: George

texts.en: George is looking forward to owning his own motorcycle to support his business and make trips to the city. He also looks forward to supporting the Community Health Workers (CHWs) in Ongata Rongai community, where he lives with his family. The community will benefit from transportation support, as some homesteads are far away from the town. George aims top grow his business and support more community health workers targeting the youth and children.

loans.use: To purchase a motorcycle for community health work and taxi business

loans.name: Aida Silvia

texts.es: La Sra. Aida 71 años es viuda y vive en casa propia.Ella es pensionada y en ocasiones ayuda en servicios a la comunidad. La Sra. Aida tiene el sueño de ver su casa remodelada y en buenas condiciones porque quiere heredar este patrimonio en un futuro a su hija que se encuentra viviendo en otra ciudad. Anteriormente le ha hecho mejoras con ahorros y apoyo que le hemos brindado, en este momento agradece y solicita nuevamente la ayuda por medio de kiva para construir una barra en la cocina..
texts.en:
Sra. Aida is 71 years old, widowed, and lives in her own home.  She is a pensioner and occasionally helps out with community service.  

Sra. Aida dreams of seeing her house remodeled and in good condition because she would like to pass on this asset in the future to her daughter, who is currently living in another city.  She previously made improvements with the use of her savings and the support that Credituyo provided.  At this moment, she expresses her appreciation and would like to request a new loan from Kiva so that she can build a bar-top counter in her kitchen.

loans.use: to build a bar-top counter in her kitchen.

loans.name: Guadalupe

texts.es:
La Sra. Guadalupe es originaria de Oaxaca, tiene viviendo en Piedras Negras desde hace 17 años, desde los 17 años de edad trabajo en su natal Oaxaca, por cuestiones de escaces de trabajo y gracias a su tía llego a la cd. de Piedras Negras en busca de mejores oportunidades y fue así donde comenzó a trabajar en una sucursal de la empresa Gutierrez en el área de enfermería donde ayuda a personas a encontrar medicamentos para mejorar su salud, se caso hace 9 años con el Sr. Julio Cesar con el cual tiene un hijo de 6 años, las personas que la conocen comentan que es una persona muy trabajadora y responsable la cual siempre le gusta salir adelante, su proposito es instalar una cerca de metal que le falta afuera de su casa para darle más seguridad a su familia.
Es por eso que la Sra. Guadalupe pide apoyo através de KIVA para llevar este proyecto a cabo y así poder sentir seguridad y tranquilidad al momento de que su hijo ande jugando en el patio, tiene tanta ilusión poder cumplirlo porque le interesa mucho el bienestar de su familia y quiere todo lo mejor para ellos.
texts.en:
Sr. Guadalupe is originally from Oaxaca, but she has lived in Piedras Negras for the past 17 years. She began working in her birthplace of Oaxaca at the age of 17, but due to the lack of jobs, she moved to the city of Piedras Negras with the help of her aunt so that she could find better opportunities. From that point, she began working at a branch of a company called “Gutierrez” in the nursing department by helping people find medicines that could improve their health.

Guadalupe has been married to Sr. Julio Cesar for nine years and they have a six-year-old child. The people who know her say that she is a hardworking and responsible person who always wants to get ahead. Her plan is to install a metal fence around the outside of her house so that her family can have more security. For this reason, Sra. Guadalupe is requesting assistance from Kiva so that she can carry out this project. As a result, she will feel more secure and have greater piece of mind whenever her child is playing in the yard. She is eager to complete this project because she is greatly interested in providing for her family’s welfare and wants them to have the very best of everything.

loans.use: to install a metal fence around her house.

loans.name: John Edison

texts.es: John de 25 años de edad, es un joven emprendedor y con un proyecto de vida definido. Laboró por más de un año en una discoteca, en donde logró ahorrar y montar su propio negocio dedicado a la venta de helados. Labora diariamente en compañía con su novia. Sueña con crecer dentro del mercado local y lograr una permanencia en el tiempo. Tiene claro que a su negocio aún le hacen faltas inversiones para mejorar la calidad en el servicio, razón que lo ha motivado a solicitar un crédito que invertirá en la compra de surtido, publicidad y dos barras de acero para adecuarlas como mesas. Asegura que con esta inversión aumentará sus ventas y podrá garantizarle a su madre una calidad de vida digna.
texts.en: John, who is 25 years old, is a young entrepreneur with a defined life plan. He worked for more than a year in a discotheque, where he managed to save to set up his own business, which is selling ice cream. He works every day alongside his girl friend. He dreams of growing in the local market and managing to achieve permanency with time. He understands that his business still needs investments to improve the quality of the service, and this has motivated him to apply for a loan that he will invest in purchasing stock, advertising, and two bars of steel to outfit as tables. He is confident that with this investment he will increase his sales and be able to guarantee his mother a dignified quality of life.

loans.use: to buy ice cream, advertising, and two bars of steel to set up tables.

loans.name: Ghadeer

texts.en: Ghadeer is a 23-year-old married lady. They still have no kids to support; but that didn't stop Ghadeer from doing her own business and making some money. While her husband works as a carpenter, Ghadeer opened a small snacks shop at home selling biscuits, chips, juice and other items. Now she is applying for a youth loan to get new stand for chips and make some shelves to add more types of biscuits and chocolates.

loans.use: to get a new stand for chips and make some shelves to add more types of biscuits and chocolates.

loans.name: James

texts.en:
James is a 40-year-old, married man. He has three children. He describes himself as a focused person. He operates a farming business, where he produces potatoes, tomatoes, and maize. He has been involved in this business for 15 years. His business is located in a rural area. He says his biggest business challenge is inadequate capital for expansion.

He will use the KES 15,000 loan to purchase seeds for planting. This is his first application for a loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to purchase seeds for planting.

loans.name: Naom

texts.en:
Naom is 26 years of age and married with two children. She runs a baby daycare and a cloth-selling business in Kangundo town. 

This is her second loan term with KADET LTD. She plans to use the loan amount to buy chairs and more utensils, such as cups and plates, for use in the baby daycare, as well as playing toys for the children. She also plans to buy more stock of clothes to sell in her clothes-selling business. 

She will use the anticipated profits to pay school fees for her children. She hopes to open a kindergarten and a nursery school.

loans.use: to buy chairs, utensils and playing toys.

loans.name: Las Flores Del Maguey Group

texts.es: Las Flores del Maguey es un grupo solidario conformado por 3 integrantes, mujeres que luchan para poder progresar perla garcia es una mujer de 46 años, tiene 3 hijos de 23, 20 y 15 años de edad y vive en unión libre, perla se dedica a la venta de frutas y verduras. a ella le ayudaría mucho el credito de 4000 cordobas en comprar mas frutas de las granjas cercanas para vender, su sueno es comprar un solar para construir la casa. La otra integrante del grupo es esmeralda que también vende frutas en el mercado.
texts.en: Las Flores del Maguey es un grupo solidario conformado por 3 integrantes, mujeres que luchan para poder progresar perla garcia es una mujer de 46 años, tiene 3 hijos de 23, 20 y 15 años de edad y vive en unión libre, perla se dedica a la venta de frutas y verduras. a ella le ayudaría mucho el credito de 4000 cordobas en comprar mas frutas de las granjas cercanas para vender, su sueno es comprar un solar para construir la casa. La otra integrante del grupo es esmeralda que también vende frutas en el mercado.

loans.use: para comprar frutas y verduras para vender

loans.name: Hilda Rosa

texts.es:
Hilda tiene 58 años de edad, y se separó de su esposo hace algún tiempo, motivo que la impulsó a buscar una fuente de ingresos para el sostenimiento de su familia, fue así como inició con un café internet ubicado en su residencia, en el cual labora diariamente de 8:00 am a 9:00 pm. Agrade a Dios la oportunidad que le ha brindado de tener su propio negocio, debido a que ha logrado mejorar su calidad de vida. 
Con el fin de garantizar un mejor servicio, Hilda se encuentra solicitando un crédito que invertirá en adecuaciones locativas y separadores de mesa. 
Sueña con crecer dentro del mercado local y convertirse en una fuente de ingresos en su comunidad.
texts.en:
Hilda is 58 years old, and she separated from her husband a while ago. This motivated her to look for a source of income in order to support her family. 

It was because of this that she opened an Internet café in her home, where she works daily from 8:00 am to 9:00 pm. She gives thanks to God for the opportunity that she has been offered to have her own business, because she has succeeded in improving her quality of life. 

With the end goal of guaranteeing better service, Hilda is requesting a loan that she will invest in improvements on her business area and in table dividers. 

She dreams of her business growing into the local market and becoming a source of income in her community.

loans.use: to make improvements on her business area and to purchase table dividers.

loans.name: Andrew

texts.en:
Andrew is a 54-year-old man. He has 6 children. He operates a rental house business where he rents houses to clients. He has been involved in this business for 5 years. His business is located in a location with plenty of customers and his primary customers are local residents. He describes his biggest business challenge to be that when it rains, water fills their rooms. 

He will use the KES 50,000 loan to put up more houses for rent. He will use the anticipated profits to put up more rooms. 

This is the client's third loan with SMEP DTM. Previous loans were paid successfully.

loans.use: to put up more houses for rent

loans.name: Flor Kantuta De San Roque Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “FLOR KANTUTA DE SAN ROQUE” iniciará el tercer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Panamericana, está compuesta por ocho  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Pamela es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de alarmas, carpintería, venta de comida, costura de chamarras, tejido de guantes de alpaca, venta de abarrotes.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Pamela es integrante, ella indica que hace cuatro años que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de una amiga que es socia de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de tienda de barrio; da a conocer que este negocio lo emprendió con un pequeño capital que formó y al ver la necesidad que se tenía en su zona.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra heladera) que adquirirá de las tiendas y posteriormente lo instalará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para mantener en lo posible a su hogar pues ella es casada y tiene dos hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el área de salud.
texts.en:
The 'Flor Kantuta de San Roque' community bank are starting their third loan cycle with Pro Mujer, as part of the Panamericana regional office.  This group has eight members and is run by a board of directors, with Pamela as its president.  The businesses that the members of the bank are engaged in are varied and include: selling alarms, carpentry, selling food, sewing jackets, knitting gloves from alpaca wool and selling groceries.

The loan that they are taking out will benefit these micro-businesswomen.  Pamela is a member of this group.  She says that she became a member of Pro Mujer four years ago, joining through an invitation from a friend who was an existing member of the institution.  She currently has a neighborhood store and says that she started her business with a little capital she had as she saw that there was a need in her area.

Pamela will use this loan to increase her working capital.  She will buy a cooler from a store and then set it up in her sales location.  This work allows her to make income with which to support her household the best she can.  Pamela is married and has two children.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, Pamela replied that she likes the health services.

loans.use: to buy a cooler

loans.name: Hieng

texts.en: Hieng is 41 and a citizen from Pursat province, Cambodia. She is married and blessed with four children, three in school and one young child. She grows rice and vegetables as the main source of income. She has been involved in the current business for 15 years, earning about 15,500 KHR per day. Hieng has been with VisionFund (Kiva's partner) for the past three loans. She has completely repaid her past loans which has supported her business on time. For this new loan, she is going to buy necessary materials to renovate her house. She hopes that her house condition will be better than before so she does not need to worry about her kids during the rainy season.

loans.use: To buy necessary materials to renovate her house

loans.name: Anta's Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupe est constitué  de quinze femmes qui habitent le même village et ont comme principales activités l'agriculture et le commerce.

La représentante Ndéye a bénéficié de 8 prêts du compte externe qu'elle a toujours remboursé sans difficultés, elle est mariée âgée de 49 ans et mère de quatre enfants, deux filles et deux garçons.Elle s'active dans l'agriculture, l'embouche et le petit commerce.Elle a une bonne expérience dans ses domaines d'activités. Sur la photo elle est à droite habillée en boubou vert et a levé la main gauche.


Elle se ravitaille  en tissus, encens, chaussures, parfums....  pour revendre dans son village; avec l'approche de l'hivernage elle va aussi investir beaucoup plus dans les semences d'arachide et haricot.

Elle compte avec son prêt acheter des semences d'arachide et haricot pour une valeur de 100000 F, des moutons pour 50000 F et diverses marchandises pour un montant de 50000 F; pour ainsi se faire beaucoup de revenus.

Avec ses bénéfices elle aide son mari dans les charges familiales, renforce son épargne afin d'obtenir un prêt plus élevé.
texts.en:
This group consists of 15 women who live in the same village. Their main activities are agriculture and commerce.
The group’s representative, Ndéye, has had eight separate loans which she has repaid without issues. She is 49 years, married, and has four children: two girls and two boys. She  grows produce, raises livestock and works as  a vendor. She has a long work experience. In the photo, she is on the right wearing a green outfit and raising her left hand.

She stocks up on fabric, incense, shoes, perfume etc. at the markets of Guéoul and Louga in order to resell in her village. With the approaching raininy season, she will increase her investments in peanut and bean seeds. With her loan, she plans to  buy peanuts and bean seeds for 100,000 West African francs, sheep  for 50,000 francs and miscellaneous merchandise for 50,0000 francs; in this way, she will earn good revenues.
She uses her income to help her husband provide for family needs and also to boost her savings in order to be able to obtain larger loans.

loans.use: to buy sheep for fattening as well as seeds.

loans.name: Ndiaya's Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupe est composé de trente femmes qui habitent le même village, elles sont amies, parentes et voisines. Leurs activités principales sont le petit commerce et l'embouche.

Madame Diakhou âgée de 41 ans est l'emprunteur en vedette ; mariée elle est mère de cinq enfants dont deux garçons, elle s'active dans le petit commerce et fait parallèlement de l’embouche.Elle capitalise une bonne expérience de 2 ans.Elle est debout vers la droite habillée en bleu et a levé la main gauche.


Avec son prêt elle envisage d'acheter 2 moutons et 3 chèvres pour embouche ovine et caprine. 

Ses bénéfices lui permettent de renforcer son épargne au niveau du Banc Villageois.
texts.en:
This group is made up of 30 women from the same village.  They happen to be friends, relatives or neighbors.  Their main businesses are retail and animal fattening.

The featured borrower, Diakhou, is a married woman and the mother of five children, including two boys.  She is actively involved in small retail business and also fattens up livestock.  She has a two-year experience in this field.  In the photo, she is standing on the right-hand side, dressed in blue and raising her left hand.

Diakhou buys sheets sewn in Touba and resells them in her village.

She plans to use her loan to buy 15 bed sheets for a total price of 112,500 francs (7,500 francs per sheet) and hopes to make a large profit at resale.

With her profits, she is able to strengthen her savings, to help her husband cover the family's expenses and to buy school supplies and medications, if necessary, for her brothers and sisters.

loans.use: to buy sheep and goats for fattening.

loans.name: Luis Oswaldo

texts.es:
Luis tiene 25 años de edad es casado tiene una hija, vive con la hija y la esposa en Chimbo Provincia de Bolívar.

Luis se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz, cebada, trigo. Solicita el crédito para comprar fertilizantes, insecticidas, herbicidas.

Con la ayuda del crédito podrá comprar lo necesario para la agricultura. 

El sueño es ser mejor en el trabajo. Las compras las realizará en la ciudad Guaranda. 

En el tiempo libre le gusta dedicarse a la hija.
texts.en:
Luis is 25 years old. He is married and has one daughter. He lives with his daughter and his wife in Chimbo, in Bolívar province.

Luis earns his living in agriculture, growing corn, barley, and wheat. He is requesting a loan to buy fertilizers, insecticides, and herbicides.

With the help of the loan, he will be able to buy what he needs for farming. He will make his purchases in the city of Guaranda.

Luis's dream is to be better at his work. In his free time, he likes to spend time with his daughter.

loans.use: to be fertilizers, insecticides, and herbicides.

loans.name: Las Super Mamis Group

texts.en:
The group "Las Super Mamis" is a hard working group of 8 members from the city of Nicolas Romero in Mexico. In the community they are know for their energy and entrepreneurial spirit. One of her members is Silvia who operates a beauty salon.

Mrs. Silvia is a 31 years old married woman with two children who has always shown an interest in hair styling; styling her friends' and family member's hair as a teenager. Because of this fascination, when she was 19 years old she decided to attend beauty school and try her hand out in this field. 

When she finally began to work as a stylist she started in a front room in her house with a chair, a small mirror, and a handful of tools, while advertising her service at a low cost to help her gain clients. As she began building her clientele with the full support of her family, she was able to expand the number of chairs, mirrors, and tools, as well as specializing and perfecting her craft. Today she has come a long way from that tiny first room to having her own locale next to her house, on one of the busiest avenues in the center of her city, Villa Nicolas Romero. 

She currently makes around $MX 4000 pesos a month and continues working hard, opening daily from 10am to 5pm while attending to all her other responsibilities as a wife and mother. Because Silvia wants to continue growing her business, over a year ago she started a group with several of her neighbors, who also are striving to grow their businesses, to ask for a loan. She has renovated three times and continues using the loan to get new products for her clients, as well as growing and modernizing the space and tools of her business.

loans.use: Modernize her

loans.name: Mai

texts.en:
Mai is 57 years old. She is married and resides with five children in Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia. She has been growing vegetables to sell for more than ten years, earning approximately $2 daily. Her husband is a construction worker who makes an income of $5 each day. Three of her children are employed. They earn $6 per day. The young man who is joining her in the picture is her son. 

Due to lack of funds, Mai is requesting a loan of $700 to purchase timber and zinc to fix her house. This money will help her provide better living conditions for the family. In the future, she would like to rent a store to sell vegetables in the market and help her children earn higher education.

loans.use: to purchase timber and zinc to fix her house

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes is married. They have two children. Agnes owns a motorcycle.Her work consists of helping people who get off the bus with their bags or taking people to their houses. This business has worked well, and she wants to buy another motorcycle taxi and work with a partner, which is why she is requesting this loan.

Agnes started with only one motorcycle, and she wants to keep growing in order to make more income and give her family a better life.

loans.use: to buy another motorcycle taxi.

loans.name: Dianking's Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupe a été créé en mai 2011,il est composé de membres qui sont issus de la même localité et ont comme activité principale le petit commerce.

Mme Bâ en foulard blanc et située à l'extrême droite sur la photo,est la responsable du groupe,elle est mariée et âgée de 56 ans.Sa principale activité est le commerce de légumes.

Elle dispose d'une bonne expérience pour ce type d'activités car l'ayant pratiqué depuis plusieurs années.

Son objectif est d'augmenter son épargne et assurer les frais liés à la nourriture pour ses enfants.
texts.en:
This group was created in May 2011.  It consists of members from the same locality.  Their main activity is small retail business.

The group's representative, Bâ, wearing a white shawl, is on the right-hand side in the photo.  She is married and 56 years old.  Her main activity is selling vegetables.

She has a good experience in her business because she has been involved in it for several years.

Her goal is to boost her savings and to cover her children's food expenses.

loans.use: to buy vegetables.

loans.name: Marianela Lourdes

texts.en:
Marianela was accepted into the Universidad Mayor De San Andrés and now with the chance to achieve her dream of a professional degree is concerned about affording tuition fees. 

She plans on graduating in July 2013, but without a loan she fears that she will need to defer her graduation. Marianela plans on using the loan to cover the cost of her graduation fees. Often there are fees for earning your title in business before graduating. 

With a career in business, she expects to earn $13 a day, a substantial increase from before. With one older sibling attending college already, Marianela is unsure how she will be able to finance her education on her own without the assistance of a loan.

This loan is administered by Vittana's partner Banco Fie.

loans.use: To pay for graduation fees

loans.name: Khady's Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupe constitué de vingt sept femmes existe depuis le 9 avril 2011; elles habitent le même village et leurs activités dominantes sont le commerce et l'élevage.

La représentante khady est mariée mère de quatre enfants dont un seul garçon.Elle mène une activité d'embouche ovine;elle capitalise une bonne expérience de 3 ans .Elle est à droite sur la photo habillée en tissu teinté avec un petit sourire et a levé la main gauche.


Avec son prêt elle compte acheter 3 moutons qu'elle va élever durant 5 mois pour les revendre après.


Avec ses bénéfices, elle compte acheter d'autres moutons et gérer ses besoins personnels.
texts.en:
This group has 27 female members and was created on April 9th 2011.  These women live in the same village and their main business activities are commerce and raising livestock.

Khady, the group's representative, is married and the mother of four children, only one of whom is a boy.  Her business is raising sheep.  She has a good 3 years experience.  Khady is standing on the right of the photo, wearing colored fabric, giving a little smile and raising her left hand.

With her loan, Khady plans to buy three sheep which she will raise for 5 months and then re-sell.  She plans to use her profits to buy more sheep and to cover her personal needs.

loans.use: to buy sheep to fatten

loans.name: Vanesa

texts.en:
Vanesa is 22 years old and lives in the town of Kalerwe in the Kampala east region of Uganda. She is single and has one child who is currently in school. For the past 2 years, Vanesa has been working hard to manage her small charcoal business, which sells clothes. 

To help expand her business, Vanesa has requested a loan of 300,000 Ugandan shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more and different types of clothes to sell, and will help Vanesa to generate greater profits and pay school fees for her child. Vanesa hopes that, in the future, she will be able to build a very big conmmatial house for herself. 

Vanesa is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to buy more and different types of clothes to sell

loans.name: Justus

texts.en:
Justus, of Kyabashenyi Ntungamo, has applied for UGX 2,300,000 for completing the building of his residential house in rural Ntungamo. She has a challenge with his homestead, which is not well closed and has holes in the iron sheets,so the rains and cold do not spare his family members during the rainy season. 

She will buy better iron sheets to improve the comfort of her family and also try plastering his house to give it a better look. She is an active farmer who will partly invest in agriculture, buying bananas for sale. She is a hardworking woman.In the photo is the Ugafode credit officer, the client, her husband, the chairperson of the village and her daughter, they were all excited when told about Kiva and eagerly loved to appear in the photo and therefore signed the waiver form.

loans.use: To buy roofing materials and iron sheets.

loans.name: Akam Divine

texts.en:
He is married with one child and they all live in a one-bedroom apartment in Bamenda, Mezam Division of the North West Region of Cameroon. He has faced many challenges in life among which are the death of both parents which caused him to drop out of school, insufficient finances to successfully manage his business, and the inability to educate his child.

With this new loan he has requested, he will buy provisions store items such as sweets, chewing gum, and vegetable oil. He will buy Maggi, pens, and notebooks. He will also invest part of the loan in the credit transfer business, which means he will buy credit cards for resell. Part of the loan will be used to pay rent, and the rest will be used to transport the items from the market where he purchases them to the retail site. 

He holds a positive view of this business succeeding because he has been involved in  this business for the past seven years and with the experience gained over the past years, he is very sure to obtain maximum profit from the business. With this business activity, the community will have a regular source of provision items.

With the profit from this loan, he will educate his child, provide three square meals to his family, cater for his child's medication and provide other necessities to his family. He will also expand his business. He prefers GHAPE loans because of the low interest rates and convenient repayment intervals, together with the training offered to members at GHAPE meetings.

loans.use: to buy items for a provision store like bonbons, biscuits, pens, and credit cards.

loans.name: Las Valentinas Group

texts.en:
The women of “Las Valentinas” live near Cahacan, a large rural locality within the Nicolas Romero municipality. These nine women are one of the first groups in this area to obtain a loan for their growing businesses. On top of micro-credit, these women benefit from Podemos Progresar’s unique platform, which includes medical assistance, access to education, business development workshops, and legal advice. To ensure that the group takes advantage of all of the credit-plus services that Podemos Progresar provides, they have been assigned a Personal Wellbeing Mentor.

For example, people working in the Mexican formal sector have access to a medical service known as IMSS, but many entrepreneurs, people working in the informal sector, or unemployed citizens do not have access to it. Podemos Progresar introduces borrowers to and helps them register for a state-run health program known as “Seguro Popular” and now everyone in the “Las Valentinas” group has access to insurance. 
 
Another Podemos Progresar feature is their sales catalog, which contains many household appliances, computers, and entertainment systems. The idea of the catalog is to provide essential home products to borrowers at the lowest price on the market. In addition, borrowers can sells these goods to their community and have the product delivered to their home free of charge.  This results in an additional income stream for borrowers and improved prices for the goods in the catalog for the community. 

Group member Cinthia, a 26 year-old mother of one, sells perfumes from her house, and occasionally house-to-house throughout her neighborhood. She began mixing fragrances four years ago and is currently collaborating with her niece to create her own fragrance. By December, Cinthia plans to move her business out of her home and into Cahuacan, where no perfume shops currently exist.

Of the nine women, only three of them have finished middle school - some, like Cinthia’s mother, Silvia, have only completed primary school. Podemos Progresar’s platform works to ensure that the entire group can earn their secondary school diplomas. In addition to this, they have access to discounted English and computer classes.

Podemos Progresar’s combination of micro-credit and aditional platform services is just the multi-dimensional solution that this group of women needs to generate sustainable businesses and wellbeing.

loans.use: to buy ingredients to make perfumes

loans.name: Las Renovadas Group

texts.en:
In the neighborhood known as “Independencia” in Nicolas Romero, Mexico, the group “Las Renovadas” definitely consists of independent women who strive to grow their businesses. Some of these businesses are new and grow out of modern niches while others have roots in the past and fill needs that make life a little bit better. Karina forms part of the latter.

Karina is 28 years old, married with one son, is the owner of two successful ice cream shops. Karina's grandparents and father are from the Mexican state of Michoacan, which is known for its delicious artisanal ice cream and popsicles. Karina’s grandparents began making and selling ice cream when they lived in Michoacan and passed on that tradition to all their children, Karina's father included. Her father then moved closer to Mexico City and happened to land in Nicolas Romero, where he stayed to have a family. Karina grew up with homemade ice cream at home and her family finally decided to open up an ice cream shop called  “Paleteria Michoacan.”  Having grown up surrounded by ice cream, she went into the family business and Karina now runs two ice cream shops and she also sells these scrumptious treats at some of the local schools during their lunch periods.

Karina has been successful with her businesses because she dedicates long hours to making the best products and her husband now helps her with the administrative side of the business. The keys to her success lie in that she is able to provide her products at a more accessible price to her clients than the other ice cream shops in the area and that she only uses high quality prime materials which create a better tasting ice cream that her clients love. She hopes to expand her business with perhaps another store, while making sure that the ones she already has continue to thrive.

loans.use: to invest in expansion of her artisanal ice cream shop

loans.name: Ariane Dudeyza

texts.en:
Becoming a professional has always been Ariane's dream. To achieve her goal, Ariane has enrolled in the Universidad Saint Paul. She plans on graduating in July 2013, but without a loan from Vittana he fears that she will need to defer his graduation.

With the loan, Ariane plans to pay for her tuition. One of her biggest challenges has been making time to work and go to school. With a career in business, she expects to earn $15 a day. As the youngest of 2, with one older sibling attending college already, Ariane is unsure how she will be able to finance her education without the assistance of a Vittana Loan. Ariane currently works 30 hours a week as a tour guide to help afford her school and living expenses.

This loan is administered by Vittana's partner Banco Fie.

loans.use: To pay for tuition

loans.name: Daniel

texts.en: Daniel lives in the Litein area of Kenya, which is home to a campus of Mt. Kenya University. He has four children and has been doing this work for nine years. His primary income sources are milk, eggs, and tea. He stated what is most enjoyable about farming as: “Juhudi's loan meetings” His biggest challenge is “Ploughing land.” Animals on the farm have been given the names of “Tin.” Daniel was asked why he chose Juhudi Kilimo for this loan, to which he replied: “Good client relations.” This client was also asked what was learned during Juhudi's required microfinance training session: “Asset financing.” His highest monthly expense is for school fees. When asked “How this loan would benefit his family”, Daniel replied “Basic needs will be more available.” As part of Juhudi's loan appraisal process, each borrower's assets are evaluated. Daniel owns the following: “cow, poultry” but does not own “pig, pump, bicycle, motorcycle, automobile”. Juhudi Kilimo also tries to measure any change in living standards based on this loan. This borrower has in the household “mosquito net, TV” but does not have “electricity, solar power, running water, sewing machine, DVD”.

loans.use: to construct a zero-grazing pen.

loans.name: Shahla

texts.en:
With 10 years experience running her own beauty salon, Shahla is one of the great entrepreneur minded women in Iraq. Living in North-Iraq, Shahla is not only taking care of her business, but she is also a mother of 5 children and as such truly understands the meaning of multitasking and time management. 

Shahla is 48 years old and is currently managing her beauty salon located in the refurbished, street-front garage of her building. The spotless, colorful, yet in many ways modest salon meets clients' hair, beauty and make up needs with the help of her staff.

Shahla understands that building a clientele differs from keeping them and it is her priority to make sure her returning clients receive something new from time to time with constantly improving care. To facilitate her investments she took a loan in the past from Relief International Microfinance Iraq, which she used for purchasing a machine for facial treatments. Shahla successfully repaid the past loan. She decided to take a new loan, this time in the amount of USD 7000 to purchase high quality raw materials for her work. Also Shahala would like to move her salon away from her home to a new location. She has already made plans for the move which is expected to take place around August, and will use part of the loan for the miscellaneous costs of the move and make improvements to the salon.

Relief International Microfinance Iraq provides qualified clients with a loan product specifically tailored for Small and Medium Enterprises (or SMEs). Select SME entrepreneurs, featured on Kiva, are participants of the program "WLIFT: Leveraging the Internet for Financial Transformation", developed for women in Iraq in a partnership between Kiva, Relief International, and the Cherie Blair Foundation. In addition to receiving credit, these female entrepreneurs also benefit from targeted technical assistance and ongoing mentoring designed to stimulate growth in their businesses.

Based on the political and social challenges of lending in Iraq, personally identifiable information about this borrower has been altered for their protection. RI-Iraq appreciates Kiva lenders' consideration of these challenges and encourages lenders to continue their support for Iraqi borrowers.

loans.use: to purchase high quality raw materials for her work and make improvements to the salon

loans.name: Albert

texts.fr: Monsieur Albert, loge dans un village situé à environ 40km de la ville principal, il est marié et père de famille. Il fait de l’embouche bovine depuis plus de 8 ans maintenant. Il a besoin de toujours renouveler son bétail puisqu’il a de la clientèle un peu partout et qu’il ne veut pas être en rupture pour les maintenir. Albert travaille de 8h à 19h du soir et fait l’entretien lui-même car, il adore son métier et a l’amour des bêtes. Il est père de famille et s’occupe des charges familiales. Le crédit impacte sur la fréquence de son épargne, sur les conditions alimentaires du foyer et sur le payement des frais de scolarité de ses enfants.
texts.en:
Mr. Albert is housed in a village about 40 km from the main city. He is married and a father.

He has been fattening cattle for over 8 years now. He always needs to renew his cattle because he has customers everywhere and he does not want to be unable to meet their needs.

Albert works from 8 am to 7 pm and takes care of the cattle himself because he loves his job and also loves animals. He is a father and takes care of family needs.

The credit loan has an impact on the frequency of his savings, on the nutritional requirements of his home, and the payment of tuition fees for his children.

loans.use: buy cattle to fatten and sell.

loans.name: Benard

texts.en: Benard is a forty-six-year-old married man with five children living in Kasese, Uganda. For twenty years he has been farming as well as buying produce from other farmers. Like most farmers he is challenged by unpredictable weather changes and inflation, while his dream is to become one of the model farmers in the region. Benard intends to use the loan to buy farm inputs such as fertilizers.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs such as fertilizers.

loans.name: Lily

texts.en:
Lily lives in the Litein area of Kenya. She has 2 children and has been doing farming work for 9 years. Her primary income sources are milk, eggs, and tea.

She said that what is most enjoyable about farming is dairy farming. Her biggest challenge is raising funds. Animals on the farm have been given no names.

Lily was asked why she chose Juhudi Kilimo for this loan, to which she replied, "because of its low interest rate."  This client was also asked what was learned during Juhudi's required micro-finance training session: "That Juhudi Kilimo is dedicated to improving lives."

Her highest monthly expense is farming costs. When asked "How will this loan benefit her family?," Lily replied, "by selling the milk produced,she will increase her income base and thus be able to educate her children."

As part of Juhudi's loan appraisal process, each borrower's assets are evaluated. Lily owns the following: 'cow, poultry' but does not own 'pig, pump, bicycle, motorcycle, automobile'. Juhudi Kilimo also tries to measure any change in living standards based on this loan. This borrower has in the household 'mosquito net, solar power, sewing machine, TV' but does not have 'electricity, running water, DVD'.

Note: To create this loan profile, Juhudi Kilimo used a mobile device to gather information in the field and send the data to a central online repository, thus reducing paper use, making the process more efficient, and keeping costs down.

loans.use: to purchase a dairy cow.

loans.name: Jipe Moyo Yombo Group

texts.en:
Watende, who is in her mid-30s, is single with one child who goes to school. She has been running a beauty salon business since 2003. She works from 6:00 a.m. to 10:00 p.m. daily and is able to make a fair monthly profit.

This will be Watende's seventh loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loans to buy more and better salon equipment and has paid back all her loans successfully. She used the profit to buy a TV set, a radio, a fridge, sofa sets, cupboards, and to pay school fees and household expenses.  She is really happy and grateful for the loan.  

She being a single parent can manage to take care of  herself and her child. She will use this loan to buy more salon equipment and to start a clothing sales business in her salon. Her dream is to one day be able to build her own house.

Watende will share this loan with her loan group, "Jipe Moyo Yombo," with 14 members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy more salon equipment and to start a clothing sales business in her salon.

loans.name: Dutezanyimbere Cb Group

texts.en: Dutezanyimbere is a group composed of different members who sell different products.  They are dedicated to upholding their business values.  Valentine is a group leader, and is married with four children.  She sells different items in her boutique, such as soap, salt, and cooking oil. Profits will be used to reinvest in the business.  In the picture, there is a young girl with her mother in the front row, while Valentine holds the Kiva borrower profile form.

loans.use: to buy foodstuffs for sale.

loans.name: Emmanuel

texts.en:
Emmanuel is a 56 year-old married man with four children aged 25, 24, 19 and 16 years-old and they live in Kamwenge, Uganda.

To earn a living, he deals in agriculture and livestock and with the proceeds he has been able to pay school fees for his children and two of them are now graduates. Pests and diseases, coupled with bad weather, affect his production while his dream is to become a model farmer.  

Emmanuel intends to use the loan to buy bulls to raise.

loans.use: to buy bulls to raise.

loans.name: Nan's Group

texts.en:
A villager from a rural area located in the Tbaung Khmum district of Kampong Cham province, Nan is 33 years old and married. She has three children, one of whom is a dependent and still in school. The primary sources of her family’s income are from rice farming and peanut planting. Having been in this business for 12 years, she can earn about 42,000 KHR per day and manages to save about 22,000 KHR each day after expenses. 

Nan has just joined VisionFund this cycle. Now she is leading her group of two to apply for a loan of 500,000 KHR each. Nan is going to use her portion to buy seeds and fertilizer for her farmland. She hopes to make more healthy peanuts and rice so as to increase her family’s income to better her living conditions and keep her child in school.

loans.use: To buy seeds and fertilizer for her farmland

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Tbaung Khmum district

loans.name: George

texts.en:
George is a married man, 39, and he has 4 children between the ages of 1 and 11. 

He operates a boda (bicycle transportation) business in an urban area; he has been in this business for six years. He will use the loan of Kes 15,000 to buy another bicycle for transportation purposes. 

George plans to use the anticipated profits to reinvest in his business. He is a committed person, hopes to open a transport company in the future, and to own some motorcycles in five years. This is his second loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: To buy another bicycle for transportation purposes.

loans.name: Christine

texts.en: Christine  is married and the mother of five children, all of whom attend school. She also cares for her younger brother, and earns a living by selling charcoal.  She has been in this business for half a year and is requesting a loan for 600,000 Ugandan shillings from MCDT-SACCO to buy more bags of charcoal. This is her sole source of income, and she works six days a week selling retail in a local market. Her major challenges include the seasonal nature of her business and thieves. Her goals for the future are to become a wholesaler and earn enough money to buy a plot of land on which she can build a house. She currently lives in her family's home and has access to electricity and piped-in water. Her monthly expenses include school fees, feeding her family and paying utility bills.

loans.use: to buy more charcoal to sell.

loans.name: El Milagro De Santa Ana Group

texts.en:
The women of this group call themselves "Milagro de Sta. Ana". Most of the women live in Santa Ana, a very small village on the outskirts of Antigua Guatemala. All of their businesses have been verified by business advisors, who believe that each woman stands to benefit from the support offered by Fundacion Namaste Guatemaya.  In addition to a loan, Namaste provides coaching from business advisors who develop a detailed understanding of the borrowers business (see below an example of how much detail they have on their clients).  

Each of the women in this group are hard-working entrepreneurial ladies that dream of growing and bettering their businesses. Most of them are involved in the production and selling of food. For example, one of them promotes her business on Facebook and provides updates on the new products she will sell in the near future. There is also a woman who sells corn meal (the only one in the area) and another who sells products by catalog. 

Carmen Lucrecia (2nd from left to right) is a 48 year-old single mom who went to school through 9th grade. She has two daughters, one that is already married who contributes Q400 ($53)  per month to the household income and a younger daughter that still lives with her. Her younger daughter also has a daughter and Carmen Lucrecia pays for her school. Carmen Lucrecia has been selling food at the park of Santa Ana for the last 12 years and has become famous for her garlic bread, a product she introduced long ago to differentiate herself from the competition. She calls her big delicious bread “Neco” and this is the main attraction for her customers. She will share this business with her daughters so they have a place to work and support their families as well. 

Her dream is to learn how to manage her income, separate her profit from her personal expenses and be able to save enough money to open a new place to sell food in the village of Jocotenango. Currently she has a profit of Q986 (US$130) and works 240 hours (US$0.54/hour) per month. Her plan for the next 9 months is to increase her profit to Q1,665 (US$220). She knows that with the support of Namaste she will learn how to calculate and better manage her profit so she can open an additional location to sell her food.

loans.use: to save money to open a new location

loans.name: Mujeres Productivas Group

texts.en:
The Mujeres Productivas group is located in Canton Siglo II*, municipality Santa Cruz Mulua, in the department of Retalhuleu, Guatemala. 

The group is  composed of six hard working women who have know each other for many years. They all are involved in buying/selling businesses or production/selling. They have demonstrated in the early educational sessions that they are motivated and very interested in learning how to keep control of their expenses and sales. 

They also mentioned that nobody has even been interested in teaching them how to work and improve their business thus they are eager to have the Business Advisor monthly visit to improve their businesses. 

Lilian is 40 years old, a widow and is raising two kids under 15 years old who are going to school (in the picture, you can see her 4th from left). She does not how to read and write and is living far away from her family. While she was living with her husband and raising their family, he suddenly fell ill and ultimately passed from an unknown illness.  They exhausted their savings on medical bills and were forced to sell all of their appliances to pay doctors and hospital bills. Widowed and broke with two kids to raise, Lilian moved to a place where she pays no rent and gets electricity from the owner. She started selling “tortillas” door to door and now she has a place to make them and sell them too. Until now, she has been producing the tortillas for lunch and dinner. 

Her dream is to be able to have enough money to buy wood and corn by bulk because it is cheaper and now with the rainy season, dry wood is very difficult to find. With these supplies, she will be able to start producing tortillas for breakfast to meet her clients requests. She wants to learn how to manage her money and separate and save it in a way that she can start purchasing all of the appliances she was forced to sell when her husband got sick. 

Her actual monthly profit is Q1,740 (US$228) and she works 170 hours per month (US$1.35 profit per hour). Her business plan is to increase her profit by 40% by adding an additional selling time and by purchasing dry wood and corn in bulk.

loans.use: Buy corn buy bulk and dry wood to improve her production/selling hours

location.town: Canton El Siglo II, Santa Cruz Mulua, Retalhuleu

loans.name: Perla

texts.en:
Perla is married and has four children. Perla is 4 years old and lives in Kauswagan, Plaridel, Misamis Occidental.

Perla sells rice to earn a living and has had this business for three years. Each month, she earns PHP 8,000 doing this type of work. 

She has requested a loan for 14,000 to pay for additional sacks of rice.

Perla has been a member of PMPC for two years. In the future, Perla hopes to have enough savings for additional capital for her business.

loans.use: to pay for sacks of rice.

loans.name: Jackline

texts.en:
Jackline lives in the Kisii area of Kenya, which is a primary bananas and sugar cane-growing region. Her primary income sources are milk, eggs, and tea. She has four children and has been doing this work for three years. 

She stated what is most enjoyable about farming: “poultry keeping”. Her biggest challenge is “Diseases”. Animals on the farm have been given the names of “Babuni”.

Jackline was asked why she chose Juhudi Kilimo for this loan, to which she replied, “Better services.” This client was also asked what was learned during Juhudi's required micro-finance training session, and replied, “Their services.”

Her highest monthly expense is business-related. When asked, “How will this loan benefit your family?”, Jackline replied, “it will avail water on the farm continuously,and thus production will increase and there will be more income.”

As part of Juhudi's loan appraisal process, each borrower's assets are evaluated. Jackline owns a cow and poultry, but does not own a pig, pump, bicycle, motorcycle, or automobile. Juhudi Kilimo also tries to measure any change in living standards based on this loan. This borrower has in the household a mosquito net, but does not have electricity, solar power, running water, sewing machine, TV, or DVD.

Note: To create this loan profile, Juhudi Kilimo used a mobile device to gather information in the field and send the data to a central online repository, thus reducing paper use, making the process more efficient, and keeping costs down.

loans.use: to purchase a water tank.

loans.name: Hugo De Jesús

texts.es: Hugo ha dedicado su vida al trabajo en el campo, con mucho esfuerzo y dedicación pudo conseguir sus propios terrenos para la siembra de fríjol y maíz, productos que comercializa en el pueblo y genera los ingresos necesarios para el sustento de su esposa y cuatro hijos. Actualmente, el señor Jairo necesita de la compra de insumos agrícolas tales como abonos, insecticidas y fungicidas que le permitan mejorar sus cultivos puesto que el invierno los ha deteriorado mucho y reducido su productividad. A sus 42 años, el sueña con tener terrenos fértiles en su finca y mejorar la calidad de vida de su grupo familiar.
texts.en: Hugo has spent his life working in the fields. With great hard work and dedication, he was able to obtain his own land for sowing beans and corn, products which he sells in the village in order to generate the necessary income to support his wife and four children. Currently, Jairo needs to purchase agricultural supplies such as fertilizer, insecticides, and fungicides. This will allow him to improve his crops, since the winter has taken a great toll on them and reduced his productivity. At the age of 42, he dreams of having fertile land and improving his family's quality of life.

loans.use: to buy insecticides and fungicides.

loans.name: Jeffrey

texts.en:
Jeffrey is a farmer.  He is 36 years old, married and has children attending school.  Jeffrey usually earns around PHP 20,000 twice a year (during harvest season) and he carefully budgets his income for food, electric bills, school allowance and as rolling capital for their farming business. 

Jeffrey wants to further develop his business.  For him to do this, he would like a loan of PHP 40,000 that he plans to use in his farming business.  He will buy pesticides and insecticides which are very useful in the farm.  He promises to pay back his loan in full and continue to improve his business and have a good harvest.

loans.use: to buy pesticides and insecticides

loans.name: Graham Billy

texts.en: My name is Billy Graham and I would like to study Financial Economics degree course in Strathmore University. This course will help me own my dreams of being an expert in financial analysis of Investment companies, Central banks and other finance research institutions-and be the ethical transformational talent in business. I am a first borne in a family of eight-five brothers and two sisters. Two of my brothers are in secondary school, four siblings in primary school and two in kindergarten. My father and mother are teachers in primary and secondary schools respectively. We are all kenyans. It is my sincere wish to study the course and materialise my dream before embarking on supporting my helpful and supportive parents as well as my siblings to help them meet their educational and career desires. I also believe and look forward to extend profound support to young minds  like me who desire to make true their goals and ambitions in life through education but are hampered by financial needs. I intend to mobilise support from my current and future colleagues as well as family to channel the least and the most they can to KIVA in terms of capital to help alleviate poverty from the ambitious and change oriented needy fellows across the globe. I humbly anticipate your support to make a reality these intentions

loans.use: to pay tuition fees for an undergraduate degree in BBS Financial Economics at Strathmore University.

loans.name: Yousif

texts.en:
Yousif is 25-year-old man with a wife and a son from Jenin, Palestine. His farm is the only income for the family and he wants to expand it to increase the family's income to cover their needs.

Yousif started his farm with 7 sheep and he'd like to buy more sheep in order to save money for his son's education and to insure a good future for his family.

He suffers from a health condition which is both a challenge and a motive for him to work hard and improve his farm.

loans.use: To expand his sheep farm

loans.name: Jeniffer

texts.en:
Jeniffer lives in the Eldoret area of Kenya, which is extremely fertile for agriculture. She has 2 children and has been doing this work for 4 years. Her primary income sources are milk,eggs, crops, personal business.

She stated what is most enjoyable about farming: 'Rearing poultry for eggs and meat'. Her biggest challenge is 'Price fluctuations, unpredictable markets for agricultural products.' Animals on the farm have been given no names.
