For the past seven years, Fred has been working hard to manage his retail shop, where he sells mostly foodstuffs, like sugar, milk and bread. 

To help expand his business, Fred has requested a loan of 2,500,000 Ugandan Shillings (UGX) from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more items to sell at the store, such as milk, soup and bread. This purchase will help Fred to generate greater profits, so he can pay his children's school fees and meet their basic needs. Fred hopes that in the future, he will be able to become a very powerful businessman in the whole town. 

Fred is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Fred, who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to purchase more items to sell at the store, such as milk, soup and bread

loans.name: Paul

texts.en:
Paul is 47 years old, married to Jane, and they are blessed with six children.

He has been in the agriculture  business for the last 10 years with a monthly income of KES 2,000.

Paul managed to get the third loan from KADET Ltd. of  KES 40,000, with which he is planning to buy seeds for planting and also to buy goods to sell.

With the anticipated profit, Paul will be able to buy more stock to expand his business.

His hope and dream is to excel in life and support his family.

loans.use: To buy seeds for planting.

loans.name: Keneth

texts.en:
Keneth is 27 years old and lives in the town of Seeta, in the Mukono region of Uganda. For the past seven years, Keneth has been working hard to manage his retail shop, which sells stationary. 

To help expand his business, Keneth has requested a loan of 3,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase a printer and reams of paper for his business, and will help Keneth to generate greater profits and take good care of himself. Keneth hopes that in the future he will be able to own an internet café. 

Keneth is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Keneth who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to purchase a printer and reams of paper for his business.

loans.name: María Isabel

texts.es:
María tiene 63 años de edad, es casada. Ella es una mujer luchadora, cuenta con 15 años de trabajar en la elaboración de tamales y oficios varios; con el firme propósito de llevar el alimento diario a su hogar. Estas actividades las aprendió de su madre que se ha dedicado a lo mismo toda la vida. Antes de aprender el oficio, ella era estudiante pero decidió mejor  dedicarse a la venta de tamales, vive con su esposo e hijos, en la propiedad de su madre.

A ella le proveen el elote para sus tamales en su casa; pero estos llevan un costo mas alto ya que se los llevan a domicilio, pero en época de invierno ella busca la materia prima en los alrededores por lo cual tiene que desplazarse grandes distancias y acarrearlo ella por sus  propios medios.

El préstamo que esta solicitando a Fundación Campo, es para la compra de recipientes, leña e ingredientes para elaborar los tamales, y a la misma vez tener capital de trabajo, porque en el verano el elote aumenta su precio y así mantener su venta y no perder los clientes. Al tener capital de trabajo la cliente,  abastecerá siempre a sus clientes y tendrá siempre todo el equipo necesario para la elaboración de los tamales y los ingresos necesarios para poder mantener a su familia.

Ella esta convencida de seguir trabajando fuerte día con día, para que a sus hijos no les falte nada y convertirlos en profesionales.
texts.en:
María, 63, is married and has been working 15 years in the "tamales" business as well as doing other jobs in order to put food on the table every day.  She learned her trade from her mother who is also in the same line of business.  Before learning her trade, María was a student, but then decided to sell tamales.  She lives with her husband and children in a house owned by her mother.

The corn she uses for the tamales is delivered to her home but it is more expensive because of the delivery.  In the winter she goes out to buy raw materirals and must travel long distances and transport the goods home through her own means.

The loan she is requesting through Fundación Campo is to buy containers, firewood and ingredients to make tamales.  She also needs working capital because, in the summer, corn prices go up; so she wants to keep selling her products and not lose customers.  By having working capital she will always have enough supply to sell to customers and be able to support her family.

María is convinced that if she works hard every day and provide everything her family needs, she will able to see her children become professionals.

loans.use: To buy containers, firewood and ingredients to make tamales, and to have working capital.

loans.name: Yayra Group

texts.fr: YAYRA qui signifie BÉNÉDICTION est un groupement constitué de femmes et d’hommes qui sont dans diverses activités (commerce, photographie…). Leurs responsable est une femme vaillante qui est mariée avec 02 enfants en charge qui sont toujours en études. Elle revend des céréales et sollicite ce second crédit pour stocker plus de marchandises afin de répondre aux besoins des clients en période de pénurie. Les autres membres également espèrent voir leur activité s’améliorer et assurer un avenir radieux à leur famille.
texts.en: YAYRA, which means "benediction" is a group made up of women and men involved in various activities (retail business, photography...).  The group's representative is an energetic married woman.  She has two children in her care who are still in school.  She resells grains and she is requesting this second loan in order to be able to store more merchandise and to better meet her customers' needs in times of shortage.  The other members of the group also hope to improve their activities and to be able to provide a bright future for their families.

loans.use: to buy grains.

loans.name: Mwanamisi

texts.en:
Mwanamisi operates a dried fish sales business, selling from her home to her neighbours and passersby. In addition she also sells firewood which is another source of her livelihood. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. She dreams of becoming a major supplier of dried fish in the near future.

With the 40,000 KES she wants to purchase 2 sacks of dried fish and 1 tonne of firewood. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase 2 sacks of dried fish and 1 tonne of firewood.

loans.name: Duc

texts.en:
Duc was born in 1974. She has two sons. One of them is working in the army. The other one is a worker. Her husband and she sell poultry eggs in the market to earn a living. Her husband's income is about 3,000,000 VND and Duc also earns about 3,000,000 VND per month. Duc has done this job for 12 years. Her family’s total earnings are about 6,000,000 VND per month. 

Duc's challenge in life and work is lacking capital to expand her business and to raise her family’s living standard. Her dream is having a more spacious house, a fuller family life,  and a larger-scale business. This loan is one of the steps that helps her reach this dream. She can invest in her business to gain earnings and save profit for her family’s life. 

Duc is a hardworking woman and has a passion for business. She has participated in SEDA's microfinance program since 2009. In the last loan cycle, she borrowed 9,184,000 VND and repaid on time. In this new loan cycle, she would again like to borrow 9,184,000 VND to retail more poultry eggs.

loans.use: to retail more poultry eggs.

loans.name: Tasleem

texts.en:
Tasleem is a 38-year-old married woman, living in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. She has been sewing dolls for the past 6 years to support her family. She beautifully sews dolls at home and then sells them in the local market. By this time she has attained a regular list of customers and makes enough to contribute to the family income. Her husband also works in a factory but earns an insufficient income to support his family alone.

She is a mother of 3 children and is motivated to provide for her family. To cope with the increasing demand of her customers, she requested a loan of 40,000 PKR to purchase stocks of threads, fancy cloths, sequins, and pearls of various colors. She hopes to get a boost in her earnings through her large sales. She is in her second loan cycle and has shown excellent repayment behaviour. She wishes to utilize a portion of revenue to provide a quality education for her children. 

She is very thankful to Kiva's field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy wool, threads, pearls, sequins and cloths for sewing doll to sell.

loans.name: Lien

texts.en:
Lien is 53 years old. She has three children. Two of them have got married. The other one is a carpenter. Her husband and she grow rice and raise chickens to earn a living. Her husband earns about 3,000,000 VND and Lien earns about 4,000,000 VND per month. She has done this job for 22 years. Her family’s total earnings are about 7,000,000 VND per month. 

Lien's challenge in life and work is that her breeding area is very small and therefore her family’s habitat is polluted. Her dream is having larger and cleaner breeding facilities to raise more chickens. This loan is one of the steps that helps her reach this dream. She would like to use this loan to raise fighting cocks, to gain earnings and save profits for her dream. 

Lien is a hardworking woman and a passionate businesswoman. She has participated in SEDA's microfinance program since 2009. In the last loan cycle, she borrowed 9,632,000 VND and repaid on time. In this first loan cycle, she would like to borrow 10,528,000 VND to breed fighting cocks and geese. She always wants to expand her breeding and raise her children well.

loans.use: to breed fighting cocks and geese.

loans.name: Adelaida

texts.en:
Adelaida is a 51-year-old married woman from Talibon, Bohol. She is engaged in a fish vending business. She sells various types of fresh fish. She has been selling fish for more than 10 years now.

Due to lack of financial capacity, Adelaida requested a loan of 10,000 PHP to buy various fresh fish to resell. In the future, Adelaida  would like to expand her fish vending business to have a sustainable livelihood.

loans.use: buy fish to resell

loans.name: Maura

texts.en:
Maura is 51 years old and married with four children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Maura has a general store business in the Philippines. Maura requested a 23,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan amount through NWTF in order to buy more items like snack foods, canned goods and other groceries.

Maura has been in this business for 10 years. In the future, Maura would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more items like snack foods, canned goods and other groceries.

loans.name: Hezouwe Group

texts.fr: Aidée par 07 personnes dans son champ, madame Binira responsable du groupement HEZOUWE est mariée et a 07 enfants en charge tous scolarisés. Le premier crédit sollicité à WAGES les aidera à acheter des outils de travail et des engrais pour avoir un bon rendement. Le profit tiré de la vente leur permettra de se prendre en charge et d’assurer un meilleur avenir à leur activité. Elle est âgée de 57ans avec une ancienneté de 05ans dans l’activité.
texts.en: Aided by seven persons in her field, Madame Binira, the leader of the group called HEZOUWE is married and raising seven children, all in school. This first loan requested from WAGES will help them to buy tools used in agriculture and fertilizer, so as to have a good harvest. The profit from the sale (of the harvested produce) will allow them to support themselves and insure a better future for their business. Madame Binira is 57 and has been working in agriculture for five years.

loans.use: to buy tools for agriculture

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en: Although she has received no prior formal education, Elizabeth is an entrepreneur. She specializes in yams and gari (powdered cassava). She usually sells in Amanfro (near Cape Coast). She has been involved in this enterprise for 8 years. Elizabeth is married and has 3 children. Her husband works as a carpenter. The proceeds from her business normally go towards helping her husband cover the family’s general expenses and paying their children’s school fees. Elizabeth wants to use her loan to purchase a greater quantity of yams and gari, thus increasing her current inventory levels. As a result, this will allow her to sell greater quantities of her tasty foods. In the long term, Elizabeth plans to reinvest the future profits back into her business, thus helping her to expand and to meet rising customer demands.

loans.use: to purchase a greater quantity of yams and gari.

loans.name: Olivo Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “OLIVO”  iniciará el segundo ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Achacachi, está compuesta por nueve integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Epifania es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: producción y venta de papa, producción y venta de hortalizas, tienda de barrio, producción de papa y chuño, venta de ganado.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Epifania es integrante, ella indica que hace seis meses que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por invitación de un promotor de la institución que fue a visitarle a su casa. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de papa, quinua y queso; da a conocer que este negocio lo aprendió de sus padres y sus suegros, ya que este es un negocio familiar.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para la el incremento de capital (compra de papa, quinua y queso) que adquirirá de las ferias de la ciudad de El Alto y posteriormente a la lo instalará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para mantener en lo posible a su hogar pues ella es casada y tiene tres hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta las capacitaciones en salud y crédito.
texts.en:
The “Olivo” communal bank will begin its second cycle with Pro Mujer as part of the Achacachi regional center.  It is comprised of nine members, and it is led by a board of directors.  Epifania is the president.  The businesses of the members of the communal bank are varied.  Among them are the production and sale of potatoes, the production and sale of vegetables, neighborhood store, production of potatoes and dried potatoes, and the sale of livestock.

The loan that they will take out will benefit small business people where Epifania is a member.  She says that she has been a member of Pro Mujer for six months.  She joined by invitation from a representative of the institution who went to visit her at her house.  She currently has a business selling potatoes, quinoa, and cheese.  She says that she learned this business from her parents and her parents-in-law because this is a family business.

The loan that she will now take out is to increase capital (to purchase potatoes, quinoa, and cheese).  She will get these at the fairs in the city of El Alto, and she will later set them up the place where she sells.  This way of working allows her to generate resources to support her household as much as possible.  She is married and has three children.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she answered that she likes the trainings about health and loans.

loans.use: to buy potatoes, quinoa, and cheese.

loans.name: Mujeres Emprendedoras Group

texts.es:
El grupo Mujeres Emprendedoras  está empezando su 1er ciclo  del programa de comité, donde todas están con una gran predisposición de viajar y mejorar sus vidas. Ellas están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de pobreza, poder conocer la situación de cada una de ellas. La encuesta mostró que 12 de ellas están por debajo de la línea de la pobreza con ingresos muy bajos.
Francisca es parte de este grupo, ella se dedica a la venta de productos de todo tipo, en su copetín, como ser galletitas, gaseosas, golosinas y comestibles. Cuenta que por medio de su esfuerzo y su sacrificio está dando a su familia todo lo que necesitan y que no tengan que pasar por ningún tipo de necesidades.
Solicita de este crédito para poder invertirlo en la compra de gaseosas, golosinas, y comestibles, con lo que podrá seguir trabajando y mejorando su vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
The group Mujeres Emprendedoras is starting its first cycle in the committee program. All its members are eager to travel and improve their lives. They are completing the poverty elimination survey in order to determine each of their situations. The survey showed that twelve of them live below the poverty line on very low income.

Francisca belongs to this group. She works selling all kinds of products from her small food counter, like cookies, sodas, sweets, and food items. She says that her effort and sacrifice have allowed her to provide her family with everything they need so that they don't have to suffer any kind of hardship.

She is requesting this loan so that she can invest it in purchasing soda, sweets, and food items. This will allow her to keep working and improving her and her family's life.

loans.use: to buy soda, candy, and food items.

loans.name: Serah

texts.en:
Serah sells cosmetics at the local market where passersby and town dwellers are her customers. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. 

Serah is applying for a 50,000 KES loan through Yehu to buy stock such as shampoo, body lotions and hair weaves for her shop. She dreams of growing her business and making more money in the future.

loans.use: to buy stock for her cosmetics shop.

loans.name: Danuvio Group

texts.es: Danuvio es un grupo nuevo, esta integrado por 8 mujeres deseosas por salir adelante. Ana es una joven de 24 años, vive en unión libre y tiene 2 niñas de 4 y 2 años. Ella se dedica a la venta de accesorios y novedades en mercados rodantes, tiene un pequeño puesto y el crédito lo usará para obtener un local establecido, ya que en un futuro Ana desea retomar sus estudios y terminar una carrera.
texts.en:
Danuvio is a new group, composed of 8 women who are eager to get ahead. 

Ana is 24 years old. She lives in a common-law marriage and has 2 girls, aged 4 and 2. She makes a living selling accessories and novelties in street markets, where she has a small stall. She plans to use the loan to obtain a storefront. 

In the future Ana wants to resume her studies and complete a degree.

loans.use: to pay for a storefront.

loans.name: Blanca Lidia

texts.es: Blanca de 46 años de edad  habita en casa de su propiedad junto con su esposo y sus dos hijos, ella se dedica a la confección y venta de prendas de vestir. El negocio está ubicado en su casa de habitación. Blanca es una mujer increíble y muy ejemplar  ya que es muy trabajadora, responsable y positiva, además, muchas personas dan buenas referencias de su persona y de su trabajo. Elabora variedad de prendas de vestir  a precios muy accesibles. También ofrece calidad en su trabajo, razón por la cual muchas personas la prefieren. Tiene muchos años de dedicarse a esta actividad por lo que ya cuenta con mucha experiencia y sobre todo con clientes fijos que cada día la prefieren más. Ha tomado la decisión de solicitar este crédito a INTEGRAL para  invertir en su pequeño negocio en la compra de los insumos necesarios como: telas, hilos, elástico, botones, etc. para la elaboración de variedad de prendas de vestir. Todo esto lo hace con el fin de dar un mejor servicio a los clientes de tal forma que los clientes se sientan motivados a seguir solicitando sus servicios y así sus ventas e ingresos se vean incrementados. Espera lograr su objetivo y mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Blanca, who is 46, lives in her own home with her husband and two children.  She makes and sells clothing and runs her business from her home.  Blanca is an amazing woman and an inspiration to others because of her hard work, responsible attitude and positive outlook.  Furthermore, a large number of people have only good things to say about her and her work.  She makes different types of clothing which she sells at affordable prices.  Her work is of high quality, making her many people's number one choice.  She has been involved in this trade for many years and so has plenty of experience and, above all, a regular clientele with whom she is increasingly popular.  

She has taken the decision to apply for this INTEGRAL loan to invest in her small business by buying the supplies (fabric, thread, elastic, buttons, etc.) which she needs to make different types of clothing.  This is all with the aim of offering her customers better service and motivating them to continue requesting her services and, as a result, boosting her sales and income.  Se hopes to achieve her objective and improve her quality of life.

loans.use: to buy fabric, thread, elastic, buttons etc.

loans.name: Irine

texts.en:
Jerotich lives in the Eldoret area of Kenya, which is extremely fertile for agriculture. She has four children and has been doing this work for four years. Her primary income sources are milk, eggs and crops.

She stated what is most enjoyable about farming: 'selling farm products'. Her biggest challenge is 'reaching the market during the rainy season'. Animals on the farm have been given the names of 'Tuikong'. 

Jerotich was asked why she chose Juhudi Kilimo for this loan, to which she replied: 'gives loans to farmers'. This client was also asked what was learned during Juhudi's required micro-finance training session: 'proper record-keeping is important for a farmer'. 

Her highest monthly expense is school fees. When asked 'How will this loan benefit her family', Jerotich replied 'improve livelihood since income will rise'. 

As part of Juhudi's loan appraisal process, each borrower's assets are evaluated. Jerotich owns the following: 'cow, poultry' but does not own 'pig, pump, bicycle, motorcycle, automobile'. Juhudi Kilimo also tries to measure any change in living standards based on this loan. This borrower has in the household 'mosquito net' but does not have 'electricity, solar power, running water, sewing machine, TV, DVD'.

Note: To create this loan profile, Juhudi Kilimo used a mobile device to gather information in the field and send the data to a central online repository, thus reducing paper use, making the process more efficient, and keeping costs down.

loans.use: To purchase poultry.

loans.name: Naomi

texts.en:
Naomi is married with four children. She received some schooling, up to the end of junior high school. Currently, Naomi works as a hairdresser in Twifo Praso (near Cape Coast). She has been involved in this industry for about four years now. Her husband is a miner. Naomi’s income goes towards helping her husband pay for the family's general expenses. 

Naomi will use the loan to increase her existing client base. With the new profits from her expanded enterprise, Naomi plans to develop her business further by venturing into newer markets.

loans.use: to increase her existing client base.

loans.name: Diamante Group

texts.es: Adriana es integrante del grupo Diamante, es una mujer casada, de 35 años, tiene 5 hijos, Paola de 15, Brandon de 14, Magaly de 8, Esperanza de 3 y Rodrigo un bebé de 5 meses y se dedica a la venta de lentes y pájaros para la decoración de casas y oficinas, el crédito lo usará para comprar los mismos artículos, ya que tiene muy buenas ventas. Su sueño es progresar para darles un buen estudio a sus hijos, y poder mejorar su casa.
texts.en:
Adriana is a member of the group “Diamante”.  She is a 35-year-old woman who is married and has five children:  Paola (age 15), Brandon (age 14), Magaly (age 8), Esperanza (age 3), and Rodrigo (a 5-month old baby).  

Adriana sells glass artifacts and live birds that are used to decorate houses and offices.  Her loan will be used to buy these items since she generates very good sales.  Adriana dreams of making progress so that she can provide a good education for her children and make improvements to her house.

loans.use: to buy glass artifacts and live birds to sell as decorations.

loans.name: Odile

texts.fr: Odile est une femme de 32 ans, sépartée de son mari et mère d'un enfant de 9 ans. Elle est commerçante et a ouvert une petite parfumerie qu'elle gère elle même depuis quelques années. C'est grâce à elle qu'elle subvient aux besoins de sa famille. grâce à son accueil chaleureux et ses relations de bon voisinage, elle a conquis et fidélisé une clientèle qui s'accroit au fil du temps, et là, elle ne parvient plus à la satisfaire totale d'où la nécessité de ce crédit dans son activité en ce moment parce qu'elle lui permettra d'augmenter son stock de marchandises (mèches et produits cosmétiques). Ceci augmentera ses ventes et donc sa marge bénéficiaire. Bénéfice qui sera en partie réinvesti dans son activité pour l'agrandir et le reste lui permettra de subvenir aux besoins de sa famille.
texts.en:
Odile is a 32-year-old woman who is separated from her husband and the mother of one child, aged 9.   She works in retail and has opened a small grocery store which she has been running by herself for a few years.  This business allows her to support her family.

Thanks to her warm welcome and to her good relationships with her neighbors, Odile has managed to attract and retain an increasingly large group of customers.  However, she can no longer meet customer demand and this is the reason why she is requesting this loan to boost her stock of staple goods.  

This loan will allow Odile to increase her sales and consequently her profit margin.  Part of her profits will be reinvested into expanding her activity, while the remaining money will be used to meet her family's needs.

loans.use: Augmenter les mèches et produits cosmétiques

loans.name: George

texts.en:
George lives in the Eldoret area of Kenya, which is a primary milk producing area. He has three children and has been doing this work for four years. His primary income sources are milk, eggs, and crops.

He stated what is most enjoyable about farming: 'grazing.' His biggest challenge is 'tick elimination.' Animals on the farm have been given the names of 'tet-cattle.'

George was asked why he chose Juhudi Kilimo for this loan, to which he replied: 'coaxed by my neighbour to join the Juhudi Kilimo group.'  This client was also asked what was learned during Juhudi's required micro-finance training session: 'animals should be kept well to enjoy good returns from them.'

His highest monthly expense is family expenses. When asked how will this loan benefit his family, George replied, 'enjoy good health due to money earned.'

As part of Juhudi's loan appraisal process, each borrower's assets are evaluated. George owns a cow, poultry, and bicycle but does not own a pig, pump, motorcycle, or automobile. Juhudi Kilimo also tries to measure any change in living standards based on this loan. This borrower has in the household a mosquito net and solar power but does not have electricity, running water, sewing machine, TV, or DVD.

Note: To create this loan profile, Juhudi Kilimo used a mobile device to gather information in the field and send the data to a central online repository, thus reducing paper use, making the process more efficient, and keeping costs down.

loans.use: to purchase a dairy cow

loans.name: Theresa

texts.en: Theresa operates a fufu selling business in Ve-Golokwati (near Hohoe). Fufu (also known as foofoo or foufou) is a paste made from starchy root vegetables put into a mortar and beaten smooth with a pestle until the desired consistency is reached. The soft dough is served and eaten with soup, such as a light tomato soup, groundnut soup, or palm oil fruit soup. Theresa is a single mother with 2 children. As the sole breadwinner in the family, Theresa uses her income to provide for the entire family. Theresa will use the loan to purchase increased amounts of cassava, tomatoes, fish, and chicken, thus aiding her to improve her overall sales. As a middle school graduate, Theresa understands the importance of education in improving social conditions, thus she plans to use her profits to ensure that all her children remain in school.

loans.use: to purchase increased amounts of cassava, tomatoes, fish and chicken.

loans.name: Katimbang

texts.en:
Katimbang works hard to support her family. Katimbang is single and has a fish vending business in the Philippines.

Katimbang is borrowing PHP 7,500 through NWTF to buy a solar lamp.

She is getting the solar lamp because wants to be able to extend her business hours even after nightfall.

Katimbang is aware that by using the solar lamp, she is saving money, helping the environment and reducing health and hazard risks to her family.

loans.use: to purchase a solar lamp.

loans.name: Agali Awamu Women's Group

texts.en:
Judith is a divorcee aged 48 and the mother of three children who are in different elementary schools. She is a group member of Agali Awamu Women’s Group, which is located on the outskirts of Kyotera town. The group is composed of five women. She is a businesswoman who owns a retail shop near the town centre. She supplements her income with some money from rentals which she inherited with her sisters from her father. She works seven days per week, and each day she works for 16 hours to maximise profits. 

The main reason she started this business is to take care of her family, since she was a single mother. Judith says she has been in this business since 2006, and through this business she has been able to educate all her children and build them a house to stay in. She has acquired this loan in order to restock her business and be able to serve her customers. Her main clients are local people around her home area. She hopes to educate her children to the higher levels of education. However, she faces the challenge of late payments by her customers and lack of capital to stock goods on time.

She describes herself as a hard-working woman and encourages lenders to reduce the interest rate for poor people. In the photograph are four people who make up 80% of the group. The fifth person was not available during the time of disbursement but signed the waiver form.

loans.use: To buy retail stock for resale.

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John is 45 years old, married, and supports four members of his family. His children are aged between 18 and 10 years. He does masonry to earn his daily living. He has been in operation for a period of seven years, earning a monthly income of KES 15,000.

John is now servicing his third loan, of KES 40,000, from KADET.  He intends to use the amount to pay school fees for his children who are in school.The intends to save the income he gets inorder to pay school fees for his children as well as invest in his business.

John desires and hopes to be financially stable in the near future.

loans.use: To pay school fees

loans.name: Zelma

texts.en:
Greetings from Sierra Leone! This is 32-year-old Zelma from Kandeh town Bo. She is married with three children between the ages of 4 and 15 years. Two of her children are currently attending school. 

Zelma runs a general store business; she sells soft drinks, mayonnaise, biscuits, and sweets. She has been running this business for 15 years. She works at the business throughout the week and 10 hours per day. Zelma says that at present her business is doing well.

Zelma has requested a loan in order to purchase soft drinks, mayonnaise, biscuits, and sweets for resale. The extra income from this loan will allow her to pay her childrens' school fees and increase her business. In the future, she plans to expand her enterprise more than ever. She thanks you for your support!

loans.use: to purchase soft drinks, mayonnaise, biscuits, and sweets for resale.

loans.name: Wafaa

texts.en:
For cultural reasons Wafaa chose not to appear in the picture, so her husband is standing in for her.

Wafaa is 24 years old and a mother of 3 children.

Wafaa and her husband Abdullah borrowed money from friends to open their own business, which is soft drinks distribution. As the business grows, Wafaa decided to take a loan to buy a rickshaw to increase the distribution.

Her future goal is to buy a big car.

Wafaa's biggest challenges is the lack of gasoline and goods because of the siege on Gaza.

loans.use: To buy a rickshaw for goods distribution

loans.name: Monica Luz

texts.es:
Monica es una mujer de 37 años, vive en la ciudad de Ica, en el distrito de Parcona con su menor hija, a quien ama y es su principal razón en la vida, ella es una persona muy amable, trabajadora y entusiasta, que dedica todos sus esfuerzos por sacar adelante a su familia, ya que ella siempre ha sido padre y madre para su hijo; lamentablemente por falta de recursos económicos y por la necesidad que tuvo de trabajar desde muy joven, Monica no pudo estudiar la carrera profesional de Pedagogía que deseaba, en sus ratos libres le gusta preparar deliciosos postres y en algunas ocasiones cocina un riquísimo Arroz con Pato para compartir con su familia.
Por iniciativa propia, con mucho empeño y dedicación, Monica trabaja como empleada del hogar, realizando labores de lavado, limpieza y cuidados del hogar, adicionalmente también prepara pasteles y tortas para su venta, ella trabaja todos los días desde tempranas horas de la mañana y puede hacerlo por un aproximado de 10 horas, Monica se siente a gusto trabajando y cree que le va bien por su responsabilidad y por el trato amable que brinda a los demás.
Monica se encuentra muy agradecida con los prestamistas Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá realizar la compra de una computadora, la cual le servirá de mucho para que su hija pueda mejorar sus métodos de estudios y también realice sus trabajos académicos, de esta manera Monica desea brindarle una buena educación a su hija y poco a poco gracias a su trabajo y esfuerzo desea lograr su gran sueño de ver a su hija convertida en una buena profesional.
texts.en:
Monica is a 37 year old woman. She lives in the city of Ica, in the Parcona district with her youngest child, who she loves and who is her main reason for living. 

She is a very friendly, hardworking and enthusiastic person, who devotes all her efforts to raising her family. She has always been the father and mother for her son. 

Unfortunately, because of a lack of economic resources and out of the need to work from a very young age, Monica was not able to study the professional career of pedagogy that she wanted to. In her free time, she likes to prepare delicious desserts, and on some occasions she cooks a tasty duck rice dish to share with her family.

By her own initiative, with much effort and dedication, Monica works as a housekeeper, performing tasks of washing, cleaning and taking care of the house. Additionally, she also prepares pies and cakes to sell. She works every day from the early hours of  the morning, and can do it for approximately 10 hours. Monica feels comfortable working and believes she does well because of her responsibility and the kind treatment she offers to others.

Monica feels very grateful for the Kiva loans, and thanks to the help provided, she will be able to purchase a computer. This will serve her very much, so that her son can improve his methods of studying and also complete his academic work. Thus, Monica wishes to provide her son with a good education. Little by little, thanks to her work and effort, she hopes to succeed in her great dream of seeing her son become a good professional.

loans.use: to buy a computer.

loans.name: Yudis Estela

texts.es: Yudis es una mujer dedicada a la actividad comercial independiente, vende productos por catálogo como perfumes, cremas corporales, cosméticos, lencería, entre otros, con lo cual ha logrado obtener recursos para soportar la carga económica en su hogar. Ella nació en una familia muy humilde, con muchas necesidades económicas, pero con el esfuerzo de sus padres lograron sacarla adelante y ahora es ella quien colabora llevando el sustento diario, gracias a los ingresos que obtiene por la venta de sus productos. Yudis es una mujer dinámica, emprendedora, siempre va con la fe puesta en Dios y poco a poco a logrado progresar, ya que siempre va en busca de oportunidades que le permitan salir adelante, por ello solicita el crédito con el fin de invertirlo en la compra de mercancía al por mayor (cosméticos, perfumes, ropa, lencería, accesorios) con el fin de aprovechar los descuentos que le dan y así poder tener más variedad de productos para ofrecerle a sus clientes, especialmente sus familiares, amigos y vecinos del sector, así tendrá la oportunidad de incrementar sus ingresos y podrá avanzar poco a poco hacia el cumplimiento de su principal sueño, que es vender productos en red para poder obtener mejores ingresos a medida que va avanzando en la cadena y así poder mejorar su calidad de vida y brindarle un mejor bienestar a su familia.
texts.en:
Yudis is a woman who is devoted to an independent commercial business activity.  She sells products like perfume, body creams, cosmetics, and lingerie, among others, by catalog.  With this business activity she has managed to get resources to manage her household's finances.

She was born into a very humble family that had a lot of financial needs.  However, with her parents’ effort, they managed to get her ahead.  Now, she is the one that helps bring home the daily bread, thanks to the income that she gets by selling her products.

Yudis ia a dynamic and enterprising woman who always has her faith placed in God.  Little by little, she has managed to make progress because she is always looking for opportunities that will allow her to get ahead.

That is why she is requesting the loan to buy merchandise wholesale (cosmetics, perfume, clothes, lingerie, accessories) in order to take advantage of the  discounts that they give.  This way she will be able to have a greater variety of products to offer her customers, especially her relatives, friends, and neighbors.  

This way she will have the opportunity to increase her income, and she will be able to advance, little by little, towards fulfilling her main dream.  That is to sell products on a network in order to be able to have improved income by advancing on the chain.  This way she will be able to improve her quality of life and her family’s welfare.

loans.use: to buy merchandise wholesale (cosmetics, perfume, clothes, lingerie, accessories).

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter lives in the Kisii area of Kenya, which is a primary banana and sugarcane growing region. He has two children and has been doing this work for two years. His primary income sources are personal business.

He stated poultry is most enjoyable about farming. His biggest challenge is diseases. Animals on the farm have been given the names of 'Nyota.'

Peter was asked why he chose Juhudi Kilimo for this loan, to which he replied it was because of better services.  This client was also asked what was learned during Juhudi's required microfinance training session and he said it was the services they offer.

His highest monthly expense is business related. When asked how this loan would benefit his family, Peter replied, "Milk production will lead to an increase in income."

As part of Juhudi's loan appraisal process, each borrower's assets are evaluated. Peter owns a bicycle but does not own a cow, pig, poultry, pump, motorcycle or automobile. Juhudi Kilimo also tries to measure any change in living standards based on this loan. This borrower has a mosquito net and sewing machine in the household but does not have electricity, solar power, running water, a TV or a DVD.

Note: To create this loan profile, Juhudi Kilimo used a mobile device to gather information in the field and send the data to a central online repository, thus reducing paper use, making the process more efficient, and keeping costs down.

loans.use: To purchase a dairy cow

loans.name: Vida

texts.en:
Vida operates a sewing business in Effia-Kuma (near Cape Coast). Vida is a single mother with one child. As the sole breadwinner in the family, Vida uses her income to provide for the entire family. 

First name will use the loan to purchase increased amounts of sewing materials, thus aiding her to improve her overall sales. As a senior high school graduate, Vida understands the importance of education in improving social conditions, thus she plans to use the profits from her expanded enterprise to ensure that all her children remain in school.

loans.use: to purchase increased amounts of sewing materials

loans.name: Esi

texts.en: Although she has received no formal education, Esi is an entrepreneur. She specializes in selling provisions in Esi (near Cape Coast). She has been involved in this enterprise for 4 years. Esi is married and has 4 children. Her husband works as an auto mechanic. The proceeds from her business normally go towards helping her husband cover the family’s general expenses and pay their children’s school fees. Esi wants to use her loan to increase her current inventory levels, hence allowing her to sell greater quantities of provisions. In the long term, Esi plans to reinvest future profits into her business, thus helping her expand and meet the needs of rising customer demand.

loans.use: to increase her current inventory levels, hence allowing her to sell greater quantities of provisions

loans.name: Djekafo Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe Djekafo est de femmes mariées qui ont en moyenne 49 ans, 3 enfants et qui vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles élargies dans le village de Warassala, Région de Koulikoro (deuxième région administrative de la république du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, de voisinage et d’amitié. Elles font le commerce de condiments, de l’arachide, des articles divers et de  la restauration.                                                                
Les femmes du groupe Djekafo sont à leurs vingt deuxième prêts solidaires. 
La cliente Konimba  1 ère  à droite  fait le commerce d’arachide tous les jours. Elle compte acheter avec son prêt 300 kilos d’arachide auprès des paysans producteurs. Elle effectue ses ventes en détails, au comptant et quelques fois à crédit à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Elle espère réaliser un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 45 000FCFA qui sera réinvesti dans l’activité et aider le mari à subvenir aux dépenses de la famille.
texts.en:
The Djenkafo group is made up of married women who, on average, are 49 years old and have three children. They all live in traditional extended families in the village of Warassala, Kouliloro (second administrative region of the Republic of Mali). The group knows each other from kinship, neighborhood, and friendship ties. 

Members of the group engage in selling condiments, groundnuts, and other various products, and food preparation. The women of the Djekafo group are on their 22nd group loan. 

Konimba, the first woman on the right [in the photo] sells groundnuts for a living. With her loan, she plans to buy 300 kilos of groundnuts from producers in the countryside. Konimba makes her sales at retail, for cash and sometimes for credit, to men and women customers.

She hopes to earn an average monthly income of 45,000 francs CFA, which will be used to reinvest in her business and to help her husband support the family expenses.

loans.use: to buy groundnuts

loans.name: Miguel Mariano

texts.es: Miguel con 53 años de edad es separado y padre de 3 hijos. Toda su vida fue criado en el campo, donde ha realizado actividades agropecuarias la myor parte de su vida.  Actualmente posee cultivos de manzanilla y complementa con la producción de leche, de varias vacas que son de su propiedad, tanto la cosecha de manzanilla, como los litros de leche que ordeña a diarios, son vendidos en el mercado de la región donde reside, así logra obtener los recursos suficientes para llevar el sustento diario a su hogar. Miguel es un hombre serio, responsable, comprometido con su familia y su trabajo, por ello siempre quiere seguir avanzando es busca de un futuro mejor, por esta razón solicita su primer ciclo de crédito para invertirlo en la compra de insumos agrícolas (abonos, fertilizantes, pesticidas) con el fin de continuar con el cuidado de sus cultivos y poder sacar una cosecha en óptimas condiciones para poderla vender a un mejor precio en el mercado y obtener más ganancias; todo esto le ayudará a seguir adelante, mejorando poco a poco su nivel de vida y el de sus hijos, a los cuales les podrá ofrecer mejor educación para que tengan un futuro próspero y lleno de éxitos.
texts.en: Miguel is 53 years old.  He is separated and the father of three children.  All his life, he was raised in the country, where he spent most of his life farming.  Now, he has chamomile plants and complements this activity with milk production from various cows that he owns.  He sells both the chamomile harvest and the liters of milk that he milks daily in a regional market where he lives.  In this way, he is able to obtain enough resources to take home the daily sustenance.  Miguel is a serious, responsible man, committed to his family and his job.  For this reason, he always wants to continue moving forward and looking for a better future.  He is in his first loan cycle and is requesting a loan to purchase agricultural inputs (manure, fertilizer, pesticides) with the goal of continuing with the care of his crops and being able to obtain a harvest in optimum conditions so that he can sell it at a better price at the market and earn higher profits.  All of this will help him continue moving ahead, gradually improving his standard of living and that of his children.  In addition, he will be able to offer his children a better education so that they will have a prosperous future filled with success.

loans.use: to purchase agricultural inputs (manure, fertilizer, pesticides).

loans.name: Grace

texts.en: Grace is married with one child who is not in school. She does not have additional family members. Grace sells secondhand clothes at the market on a retail basis. She has been in business for the last two years. She gets additional income by selling soft drinks at the market. She works seven days a week. She has requested 300,000 shillings from MCDT SACCO to buy a bale of secondhand clothes to sell. Her major challenge is seasonality and transportation. Her goal and aspiration is to open a stall which sells both clothes and soft drinks. Grace lives in a rented house, and her family has access to electricity, but does not have access to piped water. Her monthly expenses include rent and food.

loans.use: To buy a bale of secondhand clothes to sell.

loans.name: Ekow

texts.en: Although he has received no formal education, Ekow is an entrepreneur. He specializes in selling cassava and charcoal in Asebu (near Cape Coast). He has been involved in this enterprise for five years. Ekow is married and has four children. His wife works as a trader. The proceeds from his business normally go toward helping him cover the family’s general expenses and paying the children’s school fees. Ekow wants to use his loan to increase his current inventory levels, hence allowing him to sell more cassava and charcoal. In the long term, Ekow plans to reinvest future profits in his business, thus helping him expand and meet rising customer demands.

loans.use: to increase his current inventory levels, which will allow him to sell more cassava and charcoal.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph lives outside of Kakamega town, in Kakamega county. Kakamega county is located in Western Kenya and is famous for having the only tropical rainforest in the country. Most farmers in Kakamega grow maize, but sugarcane, papaya, bananas and tea are also popular crops. The variety of crops grown in the region, as well as the abundance of vegetation in the old growth forest, make Kakamega particularly attractive for beekeeping. 

Joseph is married, and has seventeen children. All of the adult members of his family help out on his farm, and he is currently growing maize, beans, vegetables and passion fruit, as well as tending to a tree plantation. Interestingly, Joseph is the brother of Honey Care Kiva borrowers Vincent, Peter and Francis. 

This is Joseph’s first loan with Honey Care, and he plans to use the income generated by his beehives to educate his children, and buy a cow. His dream for the future is “to own a pickup truck and have money to take good care of my family.”

loans.use: to buy beehives for honey production.

loans.name: Darling Daniela

texts.es: Daniela, a sus 22 años de edad es soltera y actualmente vive sola. Con su actitud emprendedora, su proyección, empuje y ganas de salir adelante, decidió montar su propio negocio, un almacén donde ofrece mercancía para adultos, ropa interior, accesorios y juguetes para uso íntimo, aprovechando que su negocio es único en el pueblo donde reside y por ende tiene muchos clientes que le generan buenos ingresos, así puede pagar sus cuentas y tener el alimento diario en su hogar. La titular solicita el segundo ciclo de crédito como apoyo, para comprar mercancía al por mayor (ropa interior, juguetes, aceites para masajes, entre otros) con el fin de aprovechar los descuentos que le brindan y así tener más variedad de productos que satisfagan los gustos de sus clientes, aumentando de esta forma el nivel de ventas y utilidades. Daniela sueña con hacer crecer su negocio, poder continuar pagando sus estudios y ayudarle a su madre con los gastos de la casa y tener una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: Daniela, age 22, is single and currently lives alone. With her enterprising attitude, her goals, her spirit and her desire to get ahead, she decided to open her own business: a store where she offers merchandise for adults, underwear, accessories, and intimate toys. Her business is the only one in her village, so she has many clients and makes a good income. She is thus able to pay her accounts and make a living. She is requesting her second loan cycle in order to buy more merchandise wholesale (underwear, toys, massage oil, and other items). Her goal is to take advantage of discounts and to have a greater variety of products to suit her clients' tastes. This will increase her sales and income. Daniela dreams of expanding her business and being able to continue paying for her studies. She wants to help her mother with her household costs and to have a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy wholesale merchandise (underwear, toys, massage oil, and other items).

loans.name: Gauda

texts.en:
Gauda is a 28-year-old, married woman, with one child, living in Kasese, Uganda. 

For two years, she has been working in the police force and, with her meager salary, she has been able to support her family. She was inspired into service by the desire to keep the law and she enjoys her work, despite poor working conditions coupled with low salary. Her dream is to venture into commercial farming, so as to diversify her income sources.

Gauda intends to use the money from the loan to buy land for farming.

loans.use: to buy land for farming.

loans.name: Marie Therèse

texts.fr: Marie Thérèse est une jeune femme de 33 ans ayant un enfant de 14 an à sa charge. elle vend des arachides dans un marché de la place. elle se trouve régulièrement confrontée à un problème de de rupture de stock au regard de la petitesse du stock.elle sollicite donc un crédit pour diversifier sa marchandise afin de s'acheter des sacs d'arachides des sacs de riz et du haricot.les bénéfices qui en résulteront lui permettront de réinvestir en partie dans son activité afin de la péréniser et plus assurer la scolarité de son fils.
texts.en: Marie Thérèse, aged 33, is a young woman who sells groundnuts at a local market and supports a 14-year-old child.  She regularly faces shortages because her stock of merchandise is very small.  She is therefore requesting this loan, which will help her to diversify her business through the purchase of bags of groundnuts, rice and beans.  Her profits will be reinvested in her activity in order to make it permanent, and also used to pay her son's school fees.

loans.use: to buy bulk quantities of groundnuts, rice and beans.

loans.name: Fe

texts.en:
Plush and Play is a Philippine-based start-up that is offering child-friendly and environment-friendly educational toys. This group provides products and services that have direct social impact to highly skilled sewers like Fe who is one of the first sewers that it has partnered with. As part of Gawad Kalinga's social enterprise program, Plush and Play is setting-up its initial sewing center in the Gawad Kalinga Enchanted Farm in Bulacan Province, Philippines and fully supports the sustainability efforts towards a poverty free Philippines by 2024.

Plush and Play is a Filipino brand that offers fun, educational, safe and relevant toys for children. With the first line of veggie-themed sewn stuffed toys locally named Manny Pakwan ("pakwan" or watermelon), Jessica Saging ("saging" or banana), Anne Kamatis ("kamatis" or tomato) it aims to provide kids with a fun learning experience about local fruits and vegetables plus their benefits. These stuffed toys are handmade by partners from Gawad Kalinga communities, with the first sewing area planned to be set-up at the Gawad Kalinga Enchanted Farm. As it highlights the undervalued sewing and crafting skills of the nanays (mothers)like Fe, it also showcases the creative genius of the poor as all of the products are co-designed by the community partners and by young university graduates. It also directs efforts into ensuring sustainability of the communities they are partnered with, fully supporting Gawad Kalinga's campaign to provide opportunities for all.

loans.use: To pay for the construction of a working space in the GK Enchanted Farm to be shared by the mothers of the community to make veggie-themed stuffed toys, garments, and other sewn items

loans.name: Nargis

texts.en:
Nargis is a 49-year-old housewife. She lives in Lahore, Pakistan. She is a mother of 6 children. Her husband owns a clothing shop in the market, which is the only source of income for the family. He sells a variety of clothes in his shop, which he purchases from various areas. 

Presently Nargis' husband is interested in offering more variety to his customers.  This will help him to increase his net income and savings as well.  However due to the lack of funds, he finds it difficult. Therefore his wife Nargis has requested for a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan so that she can help her husband to purchase a variety of clothes and sell them in the market at profitable prices. With the profit amount her husband wants to grow his business in the future. 

Nargis is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: buy clothes to resell

loans.name: Ulukman

texts.ru: Улукману 55 лет, женат и имеет 5 детей. Супруга домохозяйка помогает ему по хозяйству. В поисках  источника дохода для своей семьи, в 2007 году Улукман начал заниматься полеводством и животноводством. Стартовав с 50,000 сом (KGS), на сегодняшний день его хозяйство приносит ежемесячную прибыль в сумме 5,000 сом (KGS). В хозяйстве содержит: 1 дойную корову, 20 овец. В основном занимается выращиванием овощей и фруктов, таких как: виноград, яблоки, помидоры, клубнику для продажи, имеет земельный надел размером 2,10 ГА. Для дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Улукман обратился в Микрофинансовый банк «Бай – Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 70,000 сом (KGS) на покупку скота для увеличения поголовья скота. Доходы от кредита Улукман планирует использовать для увеличения поголовья скота, а также на проведение свадьбы своего сына.
texts.en: Ulukman is 55 years old, married, and has 5 children. His spouse is a housewife and helps around the farm. In search of the source of income for his family, Ulukman started farming and raising livestock in 2007. Starting from 50,000 somons (KGS), today his farm brings a monthly profit of 5,000 somons (KGS). On his farm, he keeps one dairy cow and 20 sheep. Mainly, he grows vegetables and fruit, such as: grapes, apples, tomatoes, and strawberries for sale.  He has a 2.10 hectare plot of land. In order to further grow his business, Ulukman has turned to Microfinance bank "Bai-Tushum and Partners" to request a loan in the amount of 70,000 somons (KGS) in order to purchase cattle to increase his herd. Ulukman plans to use the income from the loan to increase the number of livestock, as well as to pay for his son's wedding.

loans.use: to buy cows

loans.name: Chuisuc De Pamaría Group

texts.es:
La señora Catarina de estado civil casada, tiene 39 años de edad, de escolaridad 3ro. primaria, tiene 9 hijos y 3 de ellos estan estudiando, ella se dedica a la agricultura, siembra de tomates, inició este negocio con su esposo y hasta la fecha lleva 10 años de experiencia. Cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo quien se dedica a la agricultura.

Organiza un grupo y solicita un préstamo que lo utilizará para la compra de semillas para el cultivo de tomates, espera en el futuro tener grandes cosechas de tomate y otras verduras. Las demás integrantes del grupo se dedican a actividades agrícolas y pecuarias.
texts.en:
Catarina is married and is thirty-nine years old.  She attended school through the third grade.  She has nine children, and three of them are studying.  She makes a living in agriculture, growing tomatoes.  She began this business with her husband and they have ten years of experience.  She counts on the support of her husband, who also makes a living in farming.

She organized a group and is requesting a loan that she will use to buy seeds for her tomato crop.  In the future, she hopes to have large harvests of tomatoes and other vegetables.  

The other members of the group make a living in agriculture and livestock.

loans.use: to buy seeds for her tomato crop.

loans.name: Salvacion

texts.en:
Salvacion  is a farmer, raises pigs to earn a living, and  has been doing this for four years. She is 62 years old, widowed with three children and lives in Macabayao, Jimenez, Philippines.

She has requested a loan to purchase additional feed and agrivet supplies.

Salvacion has been a member of PMPC for five years. In the future, Salvacion hopes to save for future consumption.

loans.use: to purchase additional feed and agrivet supplies

loans.name: Faith

texts.en:
Faith is a 39-year-old married woman with 2 children. She lives in Macabayao, Jimenez, Philippines, where she is a farmer and raises pigs to earn a living. She has been doing this for 3 years. She has requested a loan to purchase additional feeds and other agrivet supplies.
Faith has been a member of PMPC for 1 year. In the future, Faith hopes to save for future consumption.

loans.use: to purchase additional feeds and other agrivet supplies.

loans.name: Than's Group

texts.en:
Than was born in 1980. She has three children: two are in 6th and 5th grade and one other is still little. Her husband is an iron worker to earn a living. He earns about 7,000,000 VND per month. Than grows rice and she earns about 3,000,000 VND per month. She has done this job for a long time. Besides that, Than also helps her husband in making iron. Her family’s total earnings are about 10,000,000 VND per month.

Her challenge in life and work is lack of capital to invest in her family’s iron workshop. Her dream is for her children to learn and to have enough capital to have their own careers, so they don’t need to borrow from anyone. This loan is one of the steps that will help her achieve this dream. She can invest in her iron store to gain earnings and save profits for her children’s future. Than is a hardworking and passionate businessman.

She has participated in SEDA's microfinance program since 2013. In this first loan cycle, she would like to borrow 5,014,000 VND to invest in her family’s iron store. She always wants to expand her business and for her children to grow up well.

Other members of Than's group include the following:
Chan is 28 years old. She has three children. She is in the carpentry business. She wants to borrow 5,014,000 VND to invest in her carpentry store. 
Nga is 35 years old. She has three children. She raises chickens. She wants to borrow 5,014,000 VND to invest in breeding. 
Thuan is 23 years old. She has a child. She is in the carpentry business. She wants to borrow 5,014,000 VND to invest in her carpentry store.
Mai is 23 years old. She has two children. She is in the carpentry business. She wants to borrow 5,014,000 VND to invest in her carpentry store. 
Huong is 31 years old. She has three children. She is in the carpentry business. She wants to borrow 5,014,000 VND to invest in her carpentry store.

loans.use: to invest in her family’s iron store

loans.name: Thu's Group

texts.en:
Thu was born in 1954. She has two sons who had their own families. Thu’s husband slaughters and sells pork to earn a living. He earns about 5,000,000 VND per month.

Thu sells groceries, vegetables and tofu in a market. She earns about 5,000,000 VND per month. She has done this job for eight years. Besides that, she also grows rice to earn more money. Her challenge in work is lacking capital to invest in her grocery store. Her dream is having more capital to invest in her grocery store and having a stable life. This loan is one of the steps to help her reach this dream. She is a hardworking woman and a passionate businesswoman.

She has participated in SEDA’s microfinance program since 2006. In the last loan cycle, she borrowed 9,810,000 VND and repaid on time. In this loan cycle, she wants to borrow 11,118,000 VND to buy more beer, beverages, noodles and salt for her grocery shop. She always wants to expand her grocery shop.

Other members who are part of Thu’s group include the following: 
Luong is 33 years old. She has two children. She breeds chickens and does carpentry. She wants to borrow 11,118,000 VND to invest in her business.
Tan is 51 years old. He has two children. He does carpentry. He wants to borrow 9,374,000 VND to breed chickens and do carpentry.
Tien is 42 years old. He has two children. He breeds pigs. He wants to borrow 6,758,000VND to breed pigs.
Thi is 45 years old. She has two children. She breeds chickens and does carpentry. She wants to borrow 5,014,000 VND to invest in her business.

loans.use: to buy more beer, beverages, noodles and salt for her grocery shop

loans.name: Darikha

texts.ru: Дарика, 60 лет, вдова, имеет 2 сыновей. После смерти мужа, кормильца семьи в поиске доходов для своей семьи Дарика стала заниматься полеводством и животноводством. Бизнес начала в 1981 году стартовав с 1,000 сом (KGS). Благодаря ее непосильному труду и емкой работе, а также уравновешенному характеру Дарика достигла небольших успехов в развитии хозяйства и стала получать ежемесячную прибыль в сумме 7,000 сом (KGS). На сегодняшний день в хозяйстве Дарики имеется земельный надел 10,0 ГА, на 5,ГА она сажает пшеницу, на 1,0 ГА - эспарцет, на 4, 0 ГА -ячмень. Ежегодно получает хороший урожай. Сыновья работают в государственных учреждениях и помогают материально, а также помогают по хозяйству. В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Дарика обратилась в «Бай-Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 100 000 сом (KGS) на покупку минеральных удобрений, ГСМ, а также на покупку 2 бычков. Доходы от кредита Дарика планирует вложить в дальнейшее развитие своего небольшого хозяйства, а также намерена отремонтировать сарай, в котором содержит скот.
texts.en:
Darikha is a 60-year-old widow and the mother of two sons.  After the death of her husband, she had to find a source of income for her family and got involved in crop farming and animal husbandry, thus becoming her family's only breadwinner.  She started in this business in 1981 with an initial capital of 1,000 som (KGS). Thanks to her back-breaking work, constant labor and even personality, Darikha has achieved some success in her business and began earning 7,000 som (KGS) per month.  She currently has 10 hectares of farmland on which she grows wheat on five hectares, barley on four hectares and sainfoin on the remaining one hectare.  She gets a good harvest every year.

Darikha's sons work in public institutions and help her both financially and on the farm.  In order to further develop her business, she has turned to "Bai Tushum & Partners" for a loan of 100,000 som (KGS), which will be used to buy mineral fertilizers, fuel, and two young bulls.

Darikha plans to invest the earnings from her loan into further developing her small business.  She also plans to repair a barn in which she keeps her livestock.

loans.use: to buy gobies

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is a water vendor. She has been doing this business for two years now, and the business is doing great. She also owns rental houses and she collects rental income every month. She is married and blessed with six children. 

She wants to complete building her residential home with this loan. She knew Milango through friends and since she wanted to access credit to fund her business, she decided to join in. She hasn't faced any challenges of late, and the business is great. The extra income that she will raise from the business will improve her family’s food security and development. Her living standards will be upgraded by this business loan.

loans.use: To build her house.

loans.name: Lina Gardenia

texts.es:
Lina, es soltera, tiene 1 hijo vive con su familia en el Cantón Chillanes Provincia Bolívar.

Lina trabaja de secretaria en la Registraduria de la Propiedad (empleada pública).
 Solicita el crédito para la compra de electrodomésticos como una lavadora.
Las  compras lo realizan en el Cantón Chillanes semanalmente. Con el apoyo del crédito podrá comprar  a menor precio. Su desafío es el dinero. Su sueño es comprar una casa.  En el tiempo libre  le gusta  ver televisión.
texts.en:
Lina's single and has one child.  She lives with her family in Chillanes Canton in the province of Bolívar.  She works as a secretary in the Property Registry.

Lina's requesting the loan to buy appliances such as a washing machine.  She shops weekly in Chillanes Canton.  With the support of the loan she'll be able to buy at a lower price.

Her challenge is money.  Her dream is to buy a house.  In her free time she likes to watch television.

loans.use: to buy appliances

loans.name: Santo Tomas Group

texts.es: Este grupo está conformado por cuatro socias emprendedoras una de ellas es Zela mujer de 61 años de edad, soltera, con un hijo de 34 años de edad, su negocio es la venta de mercadería variada como zapatos, ropa, cosméticos desde hace 5 años. Es cliente de la institución desde hace 5 años, el crédito lo solicita para comprar inventario como zapatos de todo estilo, ropa de varón y mujer como pantalones, blusas, camisas, camisetas, faldas, chores, camisolas, etc. María mujer de 51 años de edad, su negocio es  venta de ambientadores de fábrica, Lucia mujer 65 años , su negocio es la venta de zapatos, ropa y refrescos y Lesbia mujer de 32 años de edad y su negocio es una pulpería
texts.en: This group is made up of four enterprising members, one of whom is 61-year-old Zela.  She is single and has a 34-year-old son.  Zela has had a business selling various merchandise, such as shoes, clothes, and cosmetics for five years, during which time she has also been a member of the communal bank.  Zela is applying for this loan to buy shoes of all styles, and to buy new clothes, such as trousers, blouses, shirts, t-shirts, skirts, shorts, sports shirts, and more.  María is 51 years old and has a business selling air fresheners.  Lucia is 65 years old and has a business selling clothes, shoes and drinks.  Thirty-two year old Lesbia has a grocery store.

loans.use: to buy shoes of all styles, and to buy new clothes, such as trousers, blouses, shirts, t-shirts, skirts, shorts, sports shirts, and more.

loans.name: Quinto Piso Group

texts.es: El grupo está formado por tres socias emprendedoras una de ellas es Ana mujer de 33 años de edad, soltera, su negocio es una pulpería ubicada en su domicilio desde hace 2 años. Tiene de ser cliente de la institución 1 año. El crédito lo requiere para comprar granos básicos como arroz, frijoles crudos, azúcar, aceite, jabón, gaseosa, chiverías, cigarros, pasta de diente, shampoo, etc. Ana mujer de 33 años de edad su negocio es la
texts.en: This group is composed of three enterprising women. One of them is Ana, 33, who is single. She has had a grocery store at home for two years. She has been a client of the institution for a year. She is requesting a loan to buy grains such as rice and beans, sugar, oil, soap, sodas, snacks, cigars, tooth paste, shampoo, etc.

loans.use: to buy supplies for her grocery store, such as grains, sugar, oil, sodas and snacks.

loans.name: Arabela Group

texts.es: Este grupo está formado por cuatro socias emprendedoras exitosas una de ellas Auxiliadora mujer de 44 años de edad, soltera, con dos hijos a su cargo de 18 y 3 años. Su negocio es la elaboración y venta de nacatamales desde hace 4 años. Su hija le ayuda a despachar, Tiene de ser cliente de la institución 4 años. El crédito lo invertirá en la compra de ropa como pantalones, camisas, blusas, faldas, vestidos, camisas manga larga, shores. Mayda mujer de 33 años de edad su negocio es la venta de tortillas, Petrona mujer de 24 años su negocio es la venta de ropa y Luisa mujer de 36 años de edad y su negocio es la venta de cosméticos.
texts.en:
This group is made up of four successful and enterprising members.  One of them is Auxiliadora, 44.  She's single and has two children in her care, ages 18 and 3.

Auxiliadora has worked making nacatamales [Nicaraguan-style tamales] for the last four years.  Her daughter helps her.  She has been a client of the institution for four years.

She'll invest the loan in buying clothing such as pants, shirts, blouses, skirts, dresses, long-sleeve shirts, and shorts.

Mayda, 33, sells tortillas.  Petrona, 24, sells clothing.  Luisa, 36, sells cosmetics.

loans.use: to buy new clothing

loans.name: El Ceibo Group

texts.es: El grupo está formado por tres socias emprendedoras una de ellas es Xiomara mujer de 38 años de edad, acompañada, con cuatro hijos de 17, 13, 12 y 2 años, su negocio es la venta de carne de res en el mercado  desde hace 8 años, es cliente de la institución desde hace 5 años. El crédito lo solicita para comprar más inventario de carne de res. Patricia mujer de 27 años de edad su negocio es la venta de fritanga y Carolina mujer de 35 años de edad y su negocio es la venta de juguetes de madera.
texts.en:
This group is made up of three entrepreneurial members. One of the women is Xiomara, who is 38 years old, and has 4 children: ages 17, 13, 12, and 2. For 8 years, her business has been selling beef in the market. She has been a client of this institution for 5 years.  She requests this loan to buy more inventory of beef.

Patricia, a 27 year old woman, sells greasy food from a small restaurant. Carolina, a 35 year old woman, sells wooden toys.

loans.use: to buy more inventory of beef

loans.name: Solidario Roma Group

texts.es: Este grupo está formado por tres socias emprendedoras una de ellas es Teodora mujer de 62 años de edad, casada, su negocio es la venta de variedades como ropa, perfumes, leche agria, hielo desde hace 10 años, su esposo le ayuda económicamente  para la leche agria y la venta de hielo. Tiene 10 años de ser cliente de la institución. El crédito lo solicita para invertir en comprar pacas de ropa usada, perfumes de varón  y perfumes de mujer. Ana mujer de 52 años de edad su negocio es la venta de cosméticos y Ana Cecilia mujer de 51 años de edad y su negocio es una mini pulpería.
texts.en:
This group consists of three enterprising members. One of them is Teodora, a 62 year old married woman. For the past ten years her business has been selling a variety of things like clothing, perfume, sour milk (similar to yogurt) and ice. Her husband helps her economically with the sour milk and sale of ice. She has been a member of ADIM for 10 years now. 

The loan she is requesting will be used to buy bales of used clothing, cologne for men and perfume for women. 

Ana is 52 years old and sells cosmetics. Ana Cecilia is 51. She has a small store.

loans.use: to buy bundles of used clothing, cologne for men and woman's perfume.

loans.name: El Buen Provecho Group

texts.es: El grupo está formado por cinco socias emprendedoras una de ellas es Maritza mujer de 42 años de edad, acompañada, con dos hijos de 17 y 11 años, su negocio es la venta de cajeta y comida desde hace 16 años. Su hijo mayor y su compañero le ayudan a elaborar las cajetas que las comercializara posteriormente ambulante, es cliente de la institución desde hace 1 año y medio. El crédito lo invertirá en la compra de coco para las cajetas y materia prima para la comida como carne de res, de pollo, de cerdo, queso, plátano maduro, plátano verde, aceite, arroz, frijoles, leña, carbón, etc. Leslie mujer de 27 años de edad su negocio es la elaboración y venta de cepillos de lavar ropa, Aura mujer de 23 años su negocio la elaboración de cepillos, Elizabeth mujer de 35 años su negocio es la elaboración de cepillos y  Sonia mujer de 28 años y su negocio es la venta de cosméticos y ropa nueva.
texts.en:
The group is made up of five enterprising members.  One of them is Maritza, 42.  She's married and has two children, ages 17 and 11.

She has sold "cajeta" [caramelized milk candy] for 16 years.  Her oldest child and her companion help her make the cajeta, which she later sells on foot.  She has been a client of the institution for a year and a half.

She'll invest the loan in buying coconut for the cajeta as well as ingredients such as beef, chicken, pork, cheese, bananas, plantains, oil, rice, beans, firewood, charcoal, etc.

Leslie, 27, makes and sells clothes brushes.  Aura, 23, makes brushes.  Elizabeth, 35, makes brushes.  Sonia, 28, sells cosmetics and new clothing.

loans.use: to buy ingredients

loans.name: Mujeres Soñadoras Group

texts.es: El grupo está conformado por cuatro socias emprendedoras una de ellas es Irene mujer de 37 años de edad, casada, con tres hijos de 20, 14 y 4 años, su negocio es la venta de ropa desde hace un año. El crédito lo solicita para la compra de mercadería como blusas, talladores, camisetas, camisolas, camisas, pantalones, vestidos, etc. Vilma mujer de 60 años se dedica al negocio de la elaboración y venta de nacatamales, Anita mujer de 29 años su negocio es la venta de ropa y Dominga mujer de 57 años de edad y su negocio es la venta de comida.
texts.en:
The group is composed of 4 enterprising members, one of whom is Irene, a 37-year-old women who is married and has 3 children, ages 20, 14, and 4. Her business, for roughly a year now, is selling clothing. The loan she requests is for purchasing merchandise such as blouses, t-shirts, camisoles, shirts, pants, dresses, etc. 

Vilma is a 60-year-old woman who makes and sells Nicaraguan-style tamales. Anita is a 29-year-old woman whose business is selling clothing, and Dominga is a 57-year-old woman whose business is selling meals.

loans.use: to buy merchandise such as blouses, t-shirts, camisoles, shirts, pants, dresses, etc., to sell.

loans.name: Ambeyi

texts.en:
Ambeyi lives outside of Kakamega town, in Kakamega county. Kakamega county is located in Western Kenya and is famous for its rain forest. Many farmers in the area grow maize, sugar cane and bananas, with maize being the primary crop. The density of the old growth trees in the Kakamega forest, and the variety of crops grown in the area, make this an excellent area for beekeeping. 

Ambeyi has been farming for twenty years, and has eight children. He is currently growing sugar cane and maize on his land, as well as keeping his own beehives. He likes beekeeping because it is not a time consuming activity, and it enables him to focus on his other farming. 

This is Ambeyi’s first loan, and he plans to use the income generated by his beehives to expand his beekeeping project.

loans.use: to buy beehives for honey production.

loans.name: Vincent

texts.en:
Vincent lives on a farm outside of Kakamega town, in Kakamega county. Kakamega county is located in Western Kenya, close to the Ugandan border. It contains the only tropical rain forest in Kenya, and the variety of the flora in the region makes it well suited for beekeeping. It has one of the highest rural population densities in the world (in some areas, close to 600 people per square kilometer), which may contribute to the region's high poverty rates.

Vincent is married, and has twenty children. He has been farming for forty years, and is currently farming maize and soya beans, as well as tending to a tree plantation and rearing chickens on his land. He is excited to start beekeeping because he believes that honey is medicinal, and will also give him another income source. 

This is Vincent's first loan, and he plans to use the incomes generated by his beehives to buy a dairy cow. When asked about his hopes for the future, Vincent says he wants "my children to have high education."

loans.use: to buy beehives for honey production.

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en: Lydia is a 35-year-old married woman with 3 children living in Kamwenge, Uganda. She is a health worker at a government health center and has been in service for the past 10 years. Being the good mother that she is, she desires to educate her children to attain degrees as a minimum qualification. Her low and delayed salary is her greatest challenge, while her dream is to venture into other sources of income. Lydia intends to use the loan to start a business, specifically a retail shop.

loans.use: to start a business, specifically a retail shop.

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en:
Joyce is married with five children, and all her children go to school. She also takes care of two additional family members (grandchildren).

She has a business of rearing chickens, and has been in this business for four years. She has applied for a loan of 500,000 Uganda shillings from MCDT-SACCO to buy more chicken feeds and chicks. She works from home and sells on a retail basis.  She works seven days out of every week.  Her major business challenges include seasonality and defaulters.  

She is aspiring to own many chickens and also to educate her children up to university.  She resides in her own house and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses   include school fees and paying for utility bills.

loans.use: To buy more chicken feeds and chicks.

loans.name: Buena Vista Group

texts.es: Grupo formado por tres socias microempresarias una de ellas es Brenda mujer de 41 años de edad, soltera, con un hijo menor de 15 años, su negocio es la venta de ropa y cosméticos desde hace 5 años.
