texts.es: El cliente es de la ciudad de Quevedo.  Comenzó desde muy pequeño a trabajar en esta actividad, debido a que heredó el negocio de su padre.  Labora sembrando frutas a diario.  Es soltero y tiene 1 hijo.  Le gustaría poder incrementar su negocio a futuro.  Por ahora requiere el dinero del préstamo para la compra de fruta para su venta.
texts.en:
This borrower is from the city of Quevedo.  He started working in the business at a very young age when he took over this venture from his father.  He works by planting fruit on a daily basis.  

The borrower is single and has one child.  He would like to increase his business in the future, but for now he is requesting a loan so that he can buy fruit to sell.

loans.use: to buy fruit to sell.

loans.name: Egda Edith

texts.es: La cliente es de la ciudad de Quevedo.  Su familia es de origen sencillo y su esposo es albañil.  Comenzó esta actividad por la necesidad que tenía de ayudar económicamente en su hogar, por lo que emprendió la venta de abarrotes y poco a poco fue creciendo con la ayuda también de sus padres.  Labora todos los días desde temprano en la mañana.  Está en relación de unión libre y tiene 3 hijos de 11, 9 y 7 años, quienes estudian en la escuela fiscal de su área.  Desea poder tener un negocio grande para que su esposo no tenga que trabajar fuera de la ciudad como usualmente lo hace y de esta forma pueda estar siempre cerca de ellos.  Ahora necesita el dinero del préstamo para invertirlo en la compra de víveres y el arreglo del baño de la tienda.
texts.en:
The client is from the city of Quevado.  She is from an unassuming family, and her husband is a bricklayer.  She started this business activity out of the need that she had to help her household financially.  She undertook selling groceries.  Little by little, her business was growing, and her parents helped.  She works every day, and she starts early in the morning.  

She is in a common-law marriage, and she has three children.  The children are 11, 9, and 7, and they go to the local public school.  

She wishes to be able to have a large business so that her husband does not have to work outside of the city, as he usually does.  This way he will always be able to be close to them.

She now needs the money from the loan to buy provisions and to fix the store’s bathroom.

loans.use: to buy provisions and to fix the store’s bathroom.

loans.name: María Fernanda

texts.es: La cliente es de la ciudad de Quevedo.  Cuando su esposo falleció, su vecina le enseñó el negocio de la comida rápida y desde entonces ha emprendido en esta actividad que le ha resultado productiva.  Trabaja sola, de 4 a 8 pm.  Es viuda y tiene 2 hijos que estudian en la escuela fiscal de su sector.  Desea a futuro poder regularizar los documentos de su casa y renovarla; asimismo, gozar de salud para poder trabajar dándole gracias a Dios y brindarle a sus hijos lo necesario.  Ahora necesita el dinero del préstamo para comprar mesas, sillas y utensilios para su negocio.
texts.en:
This borrower is from the city of Quevedo.  When her husband died, a neighbor taught her the fast food business.  Since then, she has established her own enterprise and has achieved productive results.  She works alone from 4:00 P.M. to 8:00 P.M.  The borrower is widowed and has two children who attend a state school in the area.  In the future, she wants to file the paperwork for her house and make renovations to it.  At the same time, she wants to stay healthy so that she can keep working.  Thanks to God, she has been able to provide her children with what they need.  

For now, the borrower needs the money from this loan so that she can buy tables, chairs, and utensils for her business.

loans.use: to buy tables, chairs, and utensils for her business.

loans.name: Moses

texts.en:
Moses is a resident of rural Kashari in Mbarara District. He has four children and two other dependents, all in school. 

He started farming some 20 years back but could not yield much because of the poor methods he was using. That is when he got to know Ugafode microfinance and acquired a loan of UGX 1,000,000, which helped his farming business grow. Because of Moses' hard work, his business continued expanding. And now he is requesting a loan of UGX 3,000,000 to diversify his farming business by hiring labourers to till the land and plant more of the vegetables that are in high demand in the town centre.

loans.use: To hire labour and buy seeds.

loans.name: Juliet

texts.en: Juliet is married and the mother of four children, all of whom go to school. She also takes care of her mother. She has a business selling used clothes that she has been been in for many years. She has applied for a loan for 300,000 Ugandan shillings from MCDT-SACCO to buy more bales of used clothes to sell. Juliet generates additional income by selling charcoal. She goes door to door selling used clothes on a retail basis seven days a week.  Her major business challenges include transportation and the rainy season, which hinders her movement around town.  She hopes to get a permanent business address and also to build her own house.  She now lives in rented house and her family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees and rent.

loans.use: to buy more used clothes to sell

loans.name: Mohamed

texts.en: This is 50-year-old Fanta. She is a widow and has three children ages 25, 20, and 18 years. In 1990, Fanta established her frozen fish business. She began her business because she wanted to help her husband with some responsibilities. Her business is located in the outskirts, and her main customers are women. Working seven days a week for 10 hours a day, she earns about 1,000,000 SLL every month from this business. She would like a loan in the amount of 4,000,000 SLL. Fanta requires a loan to purchase more fish to resell. She hopes that this loan will support her through proper use. In the future, Fanta plans to erect a house and to make more profits. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy more bags of garri (150 to 200 bags)

loans.name: Antonia María

texts.es: La cliente es de la ciudad de Portoviejo.  Desde que se aperturó el centro comercial Paseo, el sector donde habita se volvió muy comercial, por lo que se decidió a montar un pequeño local de venta de artículos de fiesta y luego ampliar su oferta vendiendo mercadería de bazar.  Trabaja sola desde las 8 am hasta las 8 pm.  Es casada y su esposo es chofer profesional, tiene un hijo que estudia en la escuela fiscal.  Desea invertir el dinero del préstamo en mercadería de bazar y vitrinas para su negocio.

loans.use: Compra de mercadería de bazar y vitrinas

loans.name: Reina Victoria

texts.es: La cliente es de la ciudad de Quevedo.  Empezó ayudándole a su mamá y después decidió emprender por su cuenta, comprando cerdos y criándolos.  Esta actividad le resultó muy provechosa, dado que se fue  capitalizando y creciendo con el tiempo.  Lo realiza sola, desde las 7 am hasta las 4 pm.  No es casada pero tiene 2 hijos de 17 y 8 años.  Aspira poder crecer con su negocio para tener una chanchera grande y darle una mejor educación a sus hijos.  Por ahora necesita el préstamo para la compra de cerdos para su comercialización.

loans.use: Compra de cerdos

loans.name: Rosa Magdalena

texts.es: La cliente es de la ciudad de Quevedo.  Empezó trabajando en una distribuidora autorizada para telefonía, en cuanto se entrró de esta oportunidad de negocio, estudió e invirtió un poco de capital y ahora ya tiene su propio negocio.  Trabaja todos los días por su cuenta en el horario de 9 am a 6 pm.  No es casada pero tiene 1 hijo que tiene 14 años y se encuentra estudiando en la escuela fiscal de la localidad.  Le gustaría que en el futuro pueda tener a toda su familia junta y que su negocio surja para darle un estabilidad a todos ellos.  Por ahora necesita el dinero del préstamo para la compra de teléfonos, carcasas y memorias para su venta.

loans.use: Compra de teléfonos, carcasas y memorias

loans.name: Abrewa

texts.en: Although she has received no prior formal education, Abrewa is an entrepreneur. She specializes in selling smoked fish in Kufur (near Cape Coast). She has been involved in this enterprise for 22 years. Abrewa is married and has six children. Her husband works as a contractor. The proceeds from her business normally go towards helping her husband cover the family’s general expenses and pay their children’s school fees. Abrewa wants to use her loan to increase her current inventory levels, hence allowing her to sell greater quantities of fresh smoked fish. In the long term, Abrewa plans to reinvest future profits into her business, thus helping her expand and meet the needs of rising customer demands.

loans.use: to increase her current inventory levels, allowing her to sell greater quantities of fresh smoked fish.

loans.name: Angie

texts.es:
Angie ha trabajado en el comercio desde hace 10 años, siguiendo los pasos de Lina Sequeira, clienta de Fundación Mujer, quien la recomienda. Inició con el apoyo económico de su compañero y de Lina quien le vendió mercadería, ganando un margen por las ventas realizadas. Cuenta en la actualidad con una cartera de clientes y 2 personas que vende su mercadería en otras zonas de Puntarenas.
Se dedica a la venta de ropa y sandalias, brindándole ingresos a otras 2 amigas de la zona,  las que ganan un margen con las ventas. Con espíritu de servicio y apoyo a otras personas, la clienta requiere de capital para invertir para el día de la madre y diciembre. Tiene una niña de 6 meses que le motiva a seguir trabajando, su hija mayor está en la escuela y el ingreso que obtiene en su actividad, le permite apoyarla en los estudios, así como a su compañero, en los gastos del hogar, mejorando así las condiciones del núcleo familiar.
texts.en:
Angie has worked in sales for the last 10 years, following in the steps of Lina Sequeira, client of Fundación Mujer, who recommended her. She started with financial support from her partner and from Lina, who sold merchandise to her and gave her a commission on the sales made. Currently Angie has a portfolio of customers and two people who sell her merchandise in other areas of Puntarenas.

Angie makes a living from selling clothing and sandals, providing an income for two friends in the area who earn a commission on their sales. In the spirit of service and support to other people, she requires capital to invest for Mother's Day and for December. She has a 6-month-old daughter who motivates her to keep working. Her older daughter is in school and the income from her business allows her to support her daughter in her studies as well as her partner with household expenses, improving the conditions for their nuclear family.

loans.use: to buy merchandise for the periods of August and December.

loans.name: José Rafael

texts.es: El cliente reside en la ciudad de Portoviejo.  Empezó a trabajar con un hermano tiempo atrás en esta actividad, le gustó y posteriormente decidió establecer su propio negocio.  Trabaja de domingo a domingo en el mercado de su sector, donde tiene su puesto de verduras.  Es soltero, pero tiene 7 hijos, quienes son mayores de edad y 2 de ellos padecen una condición física.  Ahora necesita el dinero del préstamo para la compra de papa, cebolla y zanahoria para su comercialización.

loans.use: Compra de verduras

loans.name: Dorys Cecilia

texts.es: La cliente es de la ciudad de Portoviejo.  Empezó desde que se comprometió hace 13 años y decidió montar su tienda propia.  Desde entonces ha laborado en ella y le ha ido muy bien.  Trabaja todos los días en su negocio, el cual está en su casa propia y donde le ayudan sus hijos.  Al momento está separada de su esposo y tiene 3 hijos de 15, 10 y 6 años; todos están estudiando en la escuela fiscal.  Desea el crédito para invertirlo en la compra de azúcar, agua y detergentes para su venta.

loans.use: Compra de víveres

loans.name: Victoria Isabel

texts.es: La cliente es de Quevedo.  Empezó esta actividad como una necesidad de aportar económicamente en su hogar y ayudar a su esposo.  Le resulta muy conveniente debido a que ella tiene familia que le remite mercadería del exterior, e incluso por medio de esto, le ayuda también a su prima hasta que pueda independizarse.  Labora sola y trabaja desde su casa o también de manera ambulante de acuerdo a sus clientes.  Es casada y su esposo se desempeña como capataz en una hacienda bananera y tiene a su cargo un grupo de trabajadores.  Tiene 3 hijos de 16, 13 y 9 quienes van al colegio y escuela fiscal de su sector.  Desea a futuro terminar con la construcción de su casa y establecer su propio local para trabajar.  Ahora necesita el crédito para la compra de ropa y también una pequeña adecuación en su cocina.

loans.use: Compra de mercadería (ropa) y adecuación casa

loans.name: María Mercedes

texts.es: La cliente es de la ciudad de Quevedo.  Empezó con su propio dinero, con el cual invirtió en mercadería para comercializarla.  Labora todos los días, particularmente los fines de semana cuando sale al campo a vender sus artículos.  Se encuentra separada de su esposo, tiene 2 hijos de 17 y 8 años, quienes estudian en el colegio y escuela fiscal del sector.  A futuro, piensa en comprar un vehículo para incrementar su negocio.  Necesita el préstamo para invertirlo en la compra de zapatos, blusas y jeans para su venta.

loans.use: Compra de jeans, blusas y zapatos

loans.name: Gricelda Beatriz

texts.es: La cliente reside en Quevedo.  Empezó esta actividad cuando tuvo la posibilidad de invertir su capital propio en el comercio.  Labora todos los días sola, vendiendo su mercadería.  Al momento se encuentra en trámite de divorcio, tiene 3 hijos de 15, 13 y 7 años quienes asisten a la escuela fiscal del sector.  Le gustaría incrementar su negocio a futuro y brindarle bienestar a sus hijos.  Ahora necesita el préstamo para la compra de zapatos, jeans y blusas para su venta.

loans.use: Compra de jeans, blusas y zapatos

loans.name: Richard Antonio

texts.es: El cliente es de la ciudad de Portoviejo.  Desde que era soltero le gustó el oficio de vender lotería y por eso ha continuado realizándolo hasta ahora.  Trabaja solo desde las 8 am, almuerza y continúa con su venta a las 3 pm.  Está en estado de unión libre y su esposa es ama de casa.  Tiene hijos que son mayores de edad e independientes.  Quisiera en un futuro terminar el arreglo de su casa y ubicar su negocio en ella debido a que el sector donde habita es muy comercial.  Ahora necesita el préstamo para la compra de  billetes de lotería y artículos de plástico para su venta.

loans.use: Compra de lotería y artículos plásticos

loans.name: Roxana Lastenia

texts.es: La cliente es de la ciudad de Libertad.  Empezó trabajando con su hermano, se separó de su esposo y emprendió en esta actividad sola para poder darle lo necesario a su hija.  Trabaja todos los días, sobre todo en la mañana que es cuando recorre por su barrio y otros lados de la ciudad.  Es madre soltera y tiene 1 niña de 7 meses de edad.  Sueña más adelante con poder tener su casa propia.  Por ahora necesita el crédito para la compra de prendas de niño, interiores y otros artículos.

loans.use: Compra de ropa

loans.name: Jennifer Alexandra

texts.es: La cliente es de la ciudad de Libertad.  Ha realizado esta actividad toda su vida y le ha resultado siempre muy productiva.  Trabaja sola todo el día haciendo sus recorridos para comercializar su mercadería.  No es casada pero tiene 2 hijos que estudian en la escuela fiscal del sector.  Desea en un futuro cercano, poder incrementar su negocio grandemente para tener varios artículos surtidos.  Ahora necesita el préstamo para la compra de equipos, interiores y sostenes para su venta.

loans.use: Compra de mercadería (ropa)

loans.name: Ruth Alexandra

texts.es: La cliente reside en la ciudad de Libertad.  Empezó tiempo atrás cuando decidió estudiar belleza y aprendió del negocio, luego tuvo la posibilidad de montar su propio local.  Además de ésto, vende ropa bajo pedidos y tiene gran acogida entre sus clientes y en el sector.  Realiza su trabajo sola, todos los días.  Es madre soltera y tiene una hija que estudia en la escuela fiscal del sector.  Ahora necesita el crédito para la compra de blusas, camisas y otras prendas para su comercialización.

loans.use: Compra de ropa

loans.name: Manuel Alberto

texts.es: El cliente es de la ciudad de Libertad.  Empezó en esta actividad tiempo atrás cuando su padre le enseñó todo lo referente a mecánica y posteriormente montó su propio negocio.  Trabaja todos los días solo, en su taller.  Es soltero y no tiene hijos.  Por ahora requiere del dinero del préstamo para invertirlo en la compra de compresas, talado y oxígeno para su labor diaria.

loans.use: Compra de materiales automecánica

loans.name: Freddy Héctor

texts.es: El cliente vive en Libertad.  Empezó a vender artículos de hogar y como le fue bien, compró ropa y la comercializó en el sector también.  Su trabajo lo realiza solo, de lunes a sabado.  Es casado y su esposa no trabaja por el momento.  No tiene hijos y a futuro planea tener su propio local comercial para incrementar su negocio.  Ahora necestia el préstamo para la compra de ropa de niño, manteles, planchas y otros artículos para su venta.

loans.use: Compra de ropa y artículos de hogar

loans.name: Gloria Judith

texts.es: La cliente reside en la ciudad de Libertad.  Inició vendiendo productos cosméticos y cosiendo ropa para comercilizarla también.  Labora todos los días recorriendo varios sectores para la venta de cosméticos y trabaja en la costura desde su casa cuando le realizan pedidos.  Es casada y el esposo es mecánico, tiene una hija menor de edad, quien estudia en el colegio fiscal.  Quisiera a futuro poder tener su propio local comercial para incrementar sus ingresos.  Ahora requiere el préstamo para la compra de cremas, perfumes, telas e hilo.

loans.use: Compra de artículos de belleza

loans.name: Felicita Lorena

texts.es: La cliente es de la ciudad de Libertad.  Empezó a vender encebollado en la esquina de su casa y como le fue bien, decidió alquilar un pequeño local.  Trabaja junto con su esposo todos los días y tiene muy buena clientela.  Su esposo además trabaja como albañil realizando obras cuando se lo piden.  Tiene 3 hijos menores de edad que estudian en la escuela fiscal.  Le gustaría poder llegar a tener un local en la parte céntrica de la ciudad.  Ahora necesita el crédito para la compra de pescado, yuca, sillas y mesas.

loans.use: Compra de víveres y artículos de negocio

loans.name: Willington Rubén

texts.es: El cliente reside en Libertad.  Empezó vendiendo refrescos en su casa y de a poco fue vendiendo productos de primera necesidad hasta que pudo juntar dinero suficiente para montar su propia tienda.  Su trabajo lo realiza junto con su esposa todos los días.  Su esposa se ocupa tanto de las labores del hogar como de ayudarlo atendiendo la tienda.  Tiene hijos, son menores de edad y estudian en la escuela fiscal de su localidad.  Desearía poder tener su propio local comercial en el sector donde vive.  Por ahora requiere el préstamo para la compra de arroz, azúcar, confitería y otros productos para su negocio.

loans.use: Compra de víveres

loans.name: Lucila Amalia

texts.es: El cliente es de la ciudad de Libertad.  Empezó a vender pescado asado con su mamá y como le fue bien, empezó a prepara otros platos.  Ahora trabaja por su cuenta todos los días y ha ganado muy buena clientela.  Es casada y su esposo trabaja como guardia en un hotel de la localidad.  Tiene hijos pero ya son mayores de edad.  Desea a futuro poder tener su propio local en la parte céntrica de la ciudad.  Ahora necesita el préstamo para invertirlo en la compra de arroz, pollo, aceite y otros víveres para la preparación de los alimentos que vende.

loans.use: Compra de víveres

loans.name: Silvestre Cipriano

texts.es: El cliente es de la ciudad de Libertad.  Se ha dedicado a la pesca desde que era pequeño, junto a sus familiares.  Desde entonces le ha agradado mucho esta actividad y le ha resultado muy fructífera.  Trabaja todos los días de 3 pm a  7 am.  Es casado y su esposa se dedica principalmente a las labores domésticas.  Tiene hijos pero ya son mayores de edad.  Ahora necesita el crédito para invertirlo en la compra de pescado, camarón y langosta para su comercialización.

loans.use: Compra de mariscos

loans.name: Neri Eleuteria

texts.es: La cliente es de la ciudad de Libertad.  Inició con el negocio de costura, ahora tiene también la venta de ropa.  Trabaja sola por su cuenta de lunes a domingo de 8 am a 8 pm.  Es casada y es chofer.  Tiene hijos pero no estudian en este momento.  Aspira en un futuro cercano poder tener su propio local para tener su vitrina e incrementar más sus ventas.  Ahora necesita el crédito para la compra de blusas, camisas y otras prendas para su comercialización.

loans.use: Compra de ropa

loans.name: Manuela Natividad

texts.es: La cliente reside en la ciudad de Libertad.  Inició tiempo atrás, cuando se percató de la necesidad de buscar más ingresos para su hogar y fue ahí cuando decidió montar su tienda.  Trabaja junto a sus hijos y esposo de 7 am hasta las 10 pm.  Su esposo se dedica también a la pesca artesanal.  No tiene ya hijos menores.  Ahora necesita el crédito para la compra de colas, jugos y arroz para su venta.

loans.use: Compra de víveres

loans.name: Mario

texts.en:
Mario is a member of the group called Miramar Femenino, located in the city of Samana. This is his seventh loan, which he will use to improve his house. He has had his business for over four years and he started it from his savings. After his last loan, which he invested in his business, Mario realized the need to build an extra room. 

With this housing loan he is able to take, and with his business profits, he can build the new room and save for more home improvements. The other members of his group are recommending him for a housing loan to build this room to expand his house with more spaces. With this loan, he will be able to buy construction materials like concrete blocks, rods, cement, zinc (for the roof), and other items. 

Esperanza Internacional runs a programme for their good clients who are reliable in paying back their loans, who have fulfilled the commitment to grow their business and who have shown fidelity in their groups. This allows them to take out a loan to improve the structure of their house at the same time as running their business and attending their group meetings. Mario lives together with his wife and their three children. He is also a micro-entrepreneur conducting fish sales. He thanks God, Esperanza Internacional and all of you for this opportunity. In his name and that of his family, he thanks all of you for your support!

loans.use: To buy concrete blocks, cement, rods, and other building materials

loans.name: Mariela Karina

texts.es: La cliente es de la ciudad de Libertad.  Empezó trabajando tiempo atrás con su ex-esposo en la pesca artesanal, hasta que se separaron y ella siguió realizando esta labor.  Trabaja todos los días desde las 5 am en el puerto de Santa Rosa.  Al momento se encuentra separada de su esposo, tiene 2 hijos menores de edad y uno de ellos asiste a la escuela fiscal de su área.  Desea a futuro poder incrementar su negocio y tener más ventas.  Por ahora necesita el crédito para invertirlo en la compra de pescado y otros mariscos.

loans.use: Compra de mariscos

loans.name: Franklin Alcides

texts.es: El cliente es de la ciudad de Libertad.  Ha estudiado para llegar a ser electricista profesional y posteriormente ha instalado su propio negocio.  Trabaja solo en su casa, donde ha adecuado su pequeño taller.  Es casado y su esposa se dedica a la venta de cosméticos.  Tiene 3 hijos de 10, 4 y 9 años de edad y estudian en la escuela fiscal de su zona.  Desea en un futuro cercano, poder ampliar su negocio e para poder atender a más personas.  Por el momento desea invertir el dinero del préstamo en la compra de materiales y repuestos eléctricos necesarios para su labor.

loans.use: Compra de materiales eléctricos

loans.name: Gary Alejandro

texts.es: El cliente reside en la ciudad de Libertad.  Inició tiempo atrás con esta actividad debido a la necesidad de generar ingresos para su familia.  Labora todos los días desde temprano en la mañana y sale a recorrer en compañía de su esposa.  Ella se dedica también a la venta de ropa, tiene 2 hijos que están pequeños aún.  Desea en un futuro poder llegar a construír y tener su casa propia.  Por el momento requiere el préstamo para la compra de prendas de vestir, interiores y demás mercadería para su comercialización.

loans.use: Compra de ropa

loans.name: Esbelida Eulalia

texts.es: La cliente es de la ciudad de Libertad.  Inició tiempo atrás como comerciante de ropa, plásticos y porcelana; hasta ahora esta actividad le ha resultado muy beneficiosa.  Trabaja todo el día, en compañía de su esposo.  El también se dedica a la venta de artículos recorriendo por toda la ciudad.  No tiene hijos y a futuro le gustaría incrementar mucho más su negocio.  Por ahora necesita el crédito para la compra de platos, tasas, baldes y otros artículos para su venta.

loans.use: Compra de artículos para el hogar

loans.name: María Verónica

texts.es: La cliente es de la ciudad de Libertad.  Ha sido comerciante de diversos artículos desde hace mucho tiempo y ha ido variando su oferta de acuerdo a lo que le pidan sus clientes.  Trabaja sola todo el día, recorriendo diversos sectores de la ciudad.  Es soltera y no tiene hijos, aspira a futuro poder crecer mucho más con su negocio e incrementar sus ventas de manera sustancial.  Por ahora necesita el crédito para la compra de blusas, pantalones y ropa interior para su venta.

loans.use: Compra de ropa

loans.name: Oliver Ronald

texts.es: El cliente reside en Libertad.  Lleva 3 años en este negocio y hasta ahora le ha resultado muy productivo.  Trabaja todo el día, recorriendo diferentes sectores donde comercializa su mercadería.  Es soltero y no tiene hijos.  Desea que su negocio crezca mucho más a futuro, para poder tener mejores ingresos.  Por ahora necesita el préstamo para comprar blusas, pantalonetas e interiores para su venta.

loans.use: Compra de mercadería (ropa)

loans.name: William Alfredo

texts.es: El cliente reside en la ciudad de Libertad.  Inició tiempo atrás cuando decidió incrementar sus ingresos para el beneficio y estabilidad de su familia.  Trabaja junto a su mamá y esposa de 7 am hasta las 6 pm, todos los días.  Su esposa se encarga de las actividades domésticas y también le ayuda en la costura.  Tiene 2 hijos pero por ahora no estudian.  Quiere en un futuro incrementar su negocio para poder brindarle una mejor calidad de vida a sus hijos.  Necesita el préstamo para invertirlo en la compra de hilos, telas y botones para sus labores de confección.

loans.use: Compra de artículos de costura

loans.name: Washington Jorge

texts.es: El cliente vive en la ciudad de Libertad.  Decidió iniciar este negocio debido a que tuvo la oportunidad de estudiar electrónica y especializarse en este campo.  Trabaja solo en su taller, de 9 am a 6 pm.  Es soltero y no tiene hijos.  Desea que su negocio prospere y pueda incrementarlo de gran manera a futuro.  Por ahora necesita invertir el dinero del préstamo en la compra de insumos y repuestos electrónicos requeridos para su labor diaria.

loans.use: Compra de repuestos electrónicos

loans.name: Nicolás Faustino

texts.es: El cliente es de la ciudad de Libertad.  Aprendió esta actividad debido a que ha sido un negocio familiar que ya lleva muchos años.  Trabaja solo durante todo el día atendiendo su pequeño taller de vulcanizadora y reparación de automóviles.  Es casado y tiene 3 hijos, de 27, 24 y 10 años.  Desea a futuro poder agrandar su taller para poder atender a muchas más personas.  Ahora necesita el crédito para la compra de repuestos automotrices.

loans.use: Compra de repuestos automotrices

loans.name: Alexandra Rosario

texts.es: La cliente vive en la ciudad de Libertad.  Inició con la venta de productos de la línea Avon, luego diversificó su mercadería y decidió vender ropa también.  Trabaja todos los días de lunes a domingo, de 8 am a 6 pm.  Es casada y su esposo se desempeña como taxista.  Tiene hijos, pero ya son mayores de edad.  Le gustaría a futuro poder tener su propio local en su domicilio.  Necesita el préstamo para invertirlo en la compra de blusas, camisetas y shorts para su venta.

loans.use: Compra de ropa

loans.name: Jairo Rubén

texts.es: El cliente reside en Libertad.  Empezó con esta actividad ayudando a su padre que también se dedica a la pesca, luego emprendió por cuenta propia y hasta ahora le ha sido muy productivo.  Trabaja de lunes a sábado, de 8 am a 6 pm.  No es casado pero tiene 2 hijos menores de edad que todavía no asisten a la escuela.  A futuro le gustaría tener un negocio grande para ampliar y extenderse a otros mercados.  Ahora requiere el dinero del préstamo para la compra de albacora y corvina para su venta.

loans.use: Compra de pescado

loans.name: Gulshan's Group

texts.en:
Gulshan has applied for a loan from Kiva's partner, Asasah, for her husband's milk and yogurt selling business.
He has been operating his business for many years and due to the good quality of his yogurt and milk, he is able to make very good sales every month. 
With the loan investment, he will buy milk in larger quantities, which will help him fulfill the needs of his clients and expand his business further. 
Gulshan expects that her husband will utilize the money in a better way and increase his profits.

loans.use: to buy milk and a refrigerator for a milk and yogurt selling business.

loans.name: Mumtaz's Group

texts.en:
Mumtaz is married and supports her family by doing decorative embroidery on clothing. She is very skillful and her clients like her work very much, thus giving her regular orders every month. 

Her husband runs a business selling spare parts in the market. 

Mumtaz is a mother of 3 sons and 2 daughters. Except for her youngest daughter, her children are continuing their education by going to a nearby school. 

She has applied for a loan from Kiva's partner Asasah, for further improvements to her husband’s spare parts business.
With the loan, he will buy auto and motorbike spare parts in larger quantities and this will allow him to increase his sales and profits.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for selling at a profit.

loans.name: Rabia's Group

texts.en:
Rabia is a young mother of 2 sons. Both sons are continuing their education by going to a local school. 
Rabia's husband is a motorbike mechanic. He is an expert in his work repairing motorbikes.   
Rabia has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for further improvement of her husband's business.  The loan will be used to buy repairing tools and also some spare parts. The loan will help Rabia's husband improve his repairing business and increase his profits.

loans.use: to buy repairing tools for repairing business

loans.name: Twungurane Group

texts.fr:
Jeanine fait partie du groupe  Twungurane et  habite à Gitega. Elle a 29 ans et est mariée à Eric, un commerçant. Ensemble ils ont  4 enfants  âgés de 2 à 10 ans, dont 2 étudient. 

Elle fait le commerce de bananes   depuis 6 ans. 

Elle est à son dix-septième  crédit à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’elle obtient, elle  va  augmenter son capital et acheter beaucoup de bananes à revendre pour gagner plus.
texts.en:
Jeanine is part of the group Twungurane and lives in Gitega. She is 29 years old and is married to Eric, a shopkeeper. Together they have 4 children aged from 2 to 10 years old, of whom 2 study.

She has been selling bananas for 6 years.

She is on her seventeenth loan with Turame. With the KIVA loan that she obtains, she is going to increase her capital and buy many bananas to resell to make more.

loans.use: to increase her capital and buy many bananas to resell to make more.

loans.name: Etonam

texts.fr:
Etonam est mariée et a 26 ans. Elle est mère de 3 enfants et habite le quartier Adidogomé à Lomé. 
Depuis 5 ans, devant le portail de la maison familiale, elle vend des produits de première nécessité  et des poissons fumés. Compte tenu de son faible fonds de roulement, elle est obligée de s’approvisionner 3 fois par semaine. 
Etonam sollicite ce crédit pour acheter un sac de maïs et 18 bols de haricots, ce qui lui permettra de répondre aux besoins de ses clients.
texts.en:
Etonam, age 26, is married with three children and she lives in the district of Adidogomé, in Lomé.


For the last five years, she has been selling staples and smoked fish in front of the family home. She has to replenish her stock three times a week due to her limited capital. 


Etonam is seeking this loan to buy one sack of maize and 18 bowls of beans, which will allow her to meet customer demand.

loans.use: to buy 2 sacks of maize and 18 bowls of beans.

loans.name: Afia

texts.en:
Due to difficult circumstances, Afia did not have access to any type of formal education, yet this has not stopped her from achieving her dream of becoming an entrepreneur. Currently, Afia sells rubbers for packaging in Bremeng (near Cape Coast). She has been doing so for about six years. She is married to a farmer, and together they have four children. Afia uses all of her income to feed and provide for her family.

Afia will use the loan to purchase an increased amount of rubber for packaging, which will help her improve her overall sales. Afia wants to use future profits from her expanded business to ensure that all of her children are able to receive an education.

loans.use: purchase an increased amount of rubber package, which will help her improve her overall sales

loans.name: Essie

texts.fr:
Essie, 44 ans, est mariée et mère de deux enfants, et habite dans le quartier d’Adidomé à Lomé. Elle  vendait du maïs et du charbon, mais a dû abandonner cette activité n’ayant pas assez de fonds. Elle  s’approvisionnait à crédit et à des prix peu avantageux. La rentabilité de son activité devenait de plus en plus faible, et ne lui permettait pas de faire face aux frais de scolarité de ses enfants. 
Depuis 2008, elle commercialise du pain. Elle s’approvisionne à crédit auprès d’un boulanger de la place. Mais cette activité ne lui permet que de survivre au jour le jour. Ce crédit lui permettra de reprendre son activité de vente de maïs et charbon afin de pouvoir financer l’éducation de ses enfants et épargner pour faire face aux imprévus.
texts.en:
Essie, age 44, is married and the mother of two children.  She lives in the Adidomé neighborhood of Lomé.  She used to sell maize and charcoal, but had to give up this activity, for lack of funds.  She was stocking up on credit and at prices which were far from attractive.  Her activity was becoming less and less profitable and did not allow her to pay for her children's school fees.

Since 2008, Essie has been selling bread.  She buys bread on credit from a local baker.  However, this activity merely allows her to survive, on a day-to-day basis.

The loan that she is taking will allow her to resume selling maize and charcoal in order to pay for her children's school fees.  It will also help her to save some money to be prepared for unexpected events.

loans.use: to buy one bag of maize and 45 yam tubers.

loans.name: Ibrahim M.'s Group

texts.en:
Salone Microfinance Trust (SMT) is very pleased to present to you this group of teachers from Makeni, a city in northern Sierra Leone. This group of teachers has come to SMT to request a loan of 16,600,000 SLL for the entire group to meet their most pressing financial challenges. At the end of each month, they can repay using their monthly salaries. It is their school’s bursar who is directly responsible for doing the deductions and making the repayments on their behalf.

Ibrahim is the featured leader of this team. He is a native of Makeni city. Ibrahim is 52 years old. He is married to a trader and the couple has 5 children who are attending primary, secondary, and tertiary institutions. Ibrahim has been a school teacher for 23 years now. He has requested this loan in order to buy home building materials like iron, corrugated sheets, sand, nails, cements, etc. for the construction of a house for his family.

loans.use: to buy home building materials like iron, corrugated, sheets, sand, nails, cement, etc. for the construction of a house for his family

loans.name: Rafael Gimo

texts.pt:
Rafael de 54 anos de idade casado tem 4 filhos com idade escolar. Rafael e electricista auto e tambem comerciante, gere o seu negocio com sua esposa, o seu horario de trabalho e das 07:30 as 07:30h faz 24horas e tem 2 dias de folga durante os dias úteis, para além de ter folga no fim-de-semana.
    O emprestimo sera aplicado na compra de deterengentes para roupas, caldos, arroz, cerveja e roupas usadas. Para reforcar o seu negocio.
 As suas esperancas sao de desenvolver cada vez mais o seu negocio e ensinar tambem os seus filhos a fazer negocio. 
 O seu principal desafio e de ampliar o seu estabelecimento comercial para que fique como super mercado.
texts.en:
Rafael is 54 years old and married. He has four school-age children. Rafael is an auto electrician and also a merchant. He runs his business alongside his wife. He works from 7:30 a.m. to 7:30 a.m., a 24-hour day, and he gets two days off.
The loan will be used to purchase laundry detergent, broths, rice, beer and used clothing in order to boost his business.
He hopes to further develop his business and also teach his children to conduct business.
His main challenge is to enlarge his store so that it will be like a supermarket.

loans.use: to purchase laundry detergent, broths, rice, beer and used clothing in order to boost his business.

loans.name: Taslim

texts.en:
Meet 29-year-old Taslim from the eastern Waterloo area in Freetown. She is married with two children, ages 4 and 7.  

In 2005, Taslim established her pharmacy business. She began her business because she decided to generate income to take care of her needs. She works at the business from 8:00 am until 7:00 pm, 7 days per week. She says that the main challenge to her business is being arrested by police because she is not licensed. 

Taslim requires a loan to purchase more medical drugs to sell. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to repay her loan and increase her business. 

In the future, Taslim plans to expand her business into a big pharmacy store. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase more medical drugs to sell

loans.name: Francisco Antonio

texts.es: Francisco nació y creció en el campo, donde aprendió las labores agrícolas gracias a las enseñanzas de su familia, que toda la vida se dedicó a las tareas del campo. Hoy en día posee 4 hectáreas de tierra de su propiedad y en 3 de ellas posee cultivos de plátano, cuya cosecha es recolectada y vendida en el mercado del municipio donde reside. El cliente es un señor activo, pujante y trabajador, diariamente se levanta temprano para comenzar con el cuidado de sus cultivos que son su principal fuente de ingresos para solventar los gastos y necesidades básicas de su hogar. Se motiva para solicitar el crédito, con la intención de invertirlo en la compra de insumos agrícolas (abonos, riegos, fertilizantes, pesticidas) para preparar el terreno que tiene disponible y sembrar más cultivos, con esto le dará continuidad a su negocio aumentando su producción, lo que se verá reflejado en el incremento de sus ingresos. De esta manera, Francisco se permite soñar con tener muchos más cultivos y ser un gran comerciante de sus productos, para poder tener mejores condiciones de vida y brindar una estabilidad económica y calidad de vida a todo su núcleo familiar.
texts.en:
Francisco was born and raised in a rural area where he learned all the ways of farming from his family at a very young age. His whole life has been dedicated to agriculture, and he presently works as a farmer tending 4 hectares of his own land. The majority of Francisco's crops are plantains, and when he harvests his fruit, he sells it in the local market. Francisco is an active, energetic and hardworking man who gets up very early every morning to tend his crops, as they are his only method for supporting his family and generating income. 

With the support from this loan, Francisco plans to purchase agricultural inputs for tending his plantain crops, including manure, irrigation equipment, fertilizers and pesticides. He hope this investment will help him to take better care of his crops and increase his overall levels of production and profits. His dream is to expand his farming operation and become a great plantain trader and producer so that he can improve his family's quality of life and their financial situation.

loans.use: to purchase agricultural inputs, including manure, irrigation equipment, fertilizers, pesticides, etc.

loans.name: Florence

texts.en:
Florence lives in the Kisii area of Kenya, which is scarce of available land. She has 5 children and has been doing this work for 15 years. Her primary income sources are milk, tea, crops, personal business.

She stated what is most enjoyable about farming: 'The returns she gets from her farming activities.' Her biggest challenge is 'Seasonal changes affecting crops and animals.' Animals on the farm have been given the names of 'Nyaboke.'

Florence was asked why she chose Juhudi Kilimo for this loan, to which she replied: 'Because she wanted a good  quality dairy cow.' This client was also asked what was learned during Juhudi's required micro-finance training session: 'That they give loans to groups.'

Her highest monthly expense is school fees. When asked 'How will this loan benefit her family', Florence replied 'They will get extra income for other needs.'

As part of Juhudi's loan appraisal process, each borrower's assets are evaluated. Florence owns the following: 'cow, poultry' but does not own 'pig, pump, bicycle, motorcycle, automobile'. Juhudi Kilimo also tries to measure any change in living standards based on this loan. This borrower has in the household 'mosquito net' but does not have 'electricity, solar power, running water, sewing machine, TV, DVD'.

loans.use: To purchase a dairy cow.

loans.name: Turfosa

texts.en:
Turfosa lives in the Kisii area of Kenya, which is scarce of available land. She has five children. Her primary income sources are milk and crops, and has been doing this work for 40 years.

She stated what is most enjoyable about farming: "Feeding my cow!" Her biggest challenge is "Getting cow feeds, which are expensive." Animals on the farm have been given the names of Nya kericho.

Turfosa was asked why she chose Juhudi Kilimo for this loan, to which she replied, "Because I wanted another dairy cow."  This client was also asked what she learned during Juhudi's required micro-finance training session: "That if a dairy cow is well maintained it can service a loan."

Turfosa's highest monthly expense is family expenses. When asked how this loan will benefit her family, Turfosa replied, "They will get extra income from sell of milk."

As part of Juhudi's loan appraisal process, each borrower's assets are evaluated. Turfosa owns the following: cow and poultry but not pig, pump, bicycle, motorcycle or automobile. Juhudi Kilimo also tries to measure any change in living standards based on this loan. This borrower has in the household mosquito net but does not have electricity, solar power, running water, sewing machine, TV or DVD.

loans.use: to purchase a dairy cow.

loans.name: Rodah

texts.en:
Rodah lives in the Kisii area of Kenya, which is a primary banana and sugar cane growing region. She has seven children, and has been doing this work for 25 years.  Her primary income sources are milk and eggs.

She stated what is most enjoyable about farming: 'Milking my cows.' Her biggest challenge is: 'Treating animals when attacked by pest and diseases.' Animals on the farm have been given the names of 'Nyalango.'

Rodah was asked why she chose Juhudi Kilimo for this loan, to which she replied: 'Because their interest rate is low.'  This client was also asked what was learned during Juhudi's required micro-finance training session: 'That they give you a loan and you repay with a small interest.'

Her highest monthly expense is school fees. When asked 'How will this loan benefit your family?', Rodah replied, 'My children will not have to send me money for upkeep since I will have two cows and will be selling a lot of milk.'

As part of Juhudi's loan appraisal process, each borrower's assets are evaluated. Rodah owns the following: 'cow, poultry' but does not own 'pig, pump, bicycle, motorcycle, automobile'. Juhudi Kilimo also tries to measure any change in living standards based on this loan. This borrower has in the household 'mosquito net' but does not have 'electricity, solar power, running water, sewing machine, TV, DVD'.

loans.use: To purchase a dairy cow.

loans.name: Binu

texts.en: Binu is 24 years old. She is married and has one child, age six. Many years ago, she established her vegetable farming business. Working seven days a week and four hours a day, she supports her family. She has already received, and successfully repaid, a loan from Patan BPW, and used her most recent loan to buy vegetables for her shop. In the future, Binu plans to uplift the economic condition of her family. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy vegetables for her business.

loans.name: Alexander

texts.es: Alexander es un hombre de 37 años de edad, casado y padre de un hijo de 7 años. Desde hace 15 años comenzó su negocio de fotografía, cuyo oficio aprendió de sus familiares y contó con el apoyo de sus padres para iniciarlo. Allí, además de ofrecer el servicio de fotografía, también se dedica a  la producción de televisión, ya que se capacitó en este campo de acción, con el fin de ampliar su portafolio de servicios y complementar sus ingresos, con los cuales lleva el sustento a su hogar. Alexander es activo, entusiasta, pujante y dedicado a su familia y a su labor. Actualmente solicita el crédito como apoyo para fortalecer su negocio, el cual invertirá en la compra de activos fijos (cámara profesional, luces y computador), de esta manera podrá aumentar su patrimonio y a la vez tendrá la capacidad de ofrecer a sus clientes un mejor servicio, con mayor calidad y agilidad; lo que se verá reflejado en el incremento de sus ventas y sus ingresos y poder continuar velando por mejorar el bienestar y la calidad de vida de su familia y, brindar una mejor educación a su hijo. Es así, como Alexander desea seguir trabajando para llegar a cumplir el sueño de  producir campañas publicitarias para grandes empresas, que le generen mayores ganancias a mediano plazo.
texts.en:
Alexander is a 37 year old man. He is married and is the father of a 7 year old child. Fifteen years ago he opened his photography business, learning the trade from his family members and relying on the support of his parents to get started. Now, besides offering his photography services, he also works in video production (a field in which he has been trained) with the purpose of expanding his portfolio of services and supplementing his income. This income is the means of support for his home.

Alexander is active, enthusiastic, thriving, and dedicated to his family and his work. Currently he is seeking a loan as a means of support to strengthen his business. He will invest it in fixed assets (a professional camera, lights, and a computer). In this way he will be able to increase his assets. At the same time, he will be able to offer his clients better service, with better quality and flexibility, which should be reflected in an increase in sales and income. He will be able to continue to safeguard and improve the well-being and quality of life of his family, and to give a better education to his child. As Alexander would like to keep working to eventually achieve his dream of producing publicity campaigns for major companies, in the meanwhile this will generate higher earnings.

loans.use: to buy fixed assets such as a professional camera, lights, and computer.

loans.name: Los Luchadores De Ramón Castilla Group

texts.es:
LUISA, tiene 32 años de edad, tiene dos pequeños niños en edad escolar, por lo que ellos son su mayor motivo para superarse y crecer en su negocio de venta de productos de belleza. Luisa forma parte del grupo "Los Luchadores de Ramón Castilla" formado por 7 socios.
Luisa, se dedica desde aproximadamente un año a la venta de productos de belleza mediante catalogo, es un negocio independiente que le permite estar cerca de sus hijos ya que ella puede elegir el mejor horario para realizar sus ventas.
El préstamo recibido lo invertirá en la compra de productos de belleza que se encuentran en oferta en los catálogos de campaña, así podrá aprovechar en adquirirlos a bajo precio, tener un mayor margen de ganancia y tener un stock.
En la fotografía se puede ubicar a Luisa, ella es la más alta del grupo. El Sr. Jose no pudo estar presente en la fotografía por motivo de trabajo.
texts.en:
Luisa, 32, has two young school-age children.  They're her greatest motivation to improve herself and grow in her business selling beauty products.  Luisa's part of Los Luchadores de Ramón Castilla Group, made up of seven members.

Luisa has been selling beauty products from a catalogue for about a year.  It's an independent business that allows her to be near her children.  She can choose the best schedule to make her sales.

She'll invest the loan she received in buying beauty products on sale in the seasonal catalogues.  This way she'll make the most of getting them for a low price, having a greater profit margin, and having a supply.

In the photograph Luisa's seated third from the left, wearing a white shirt.

loans.use: to buy beauty products

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en:
Joyce is a Kiva borrower. She has two children, 8 and 13 years old. She describes herself to be intelligent and brilliant. She operates a household goods store where she sells household furniture. She has been involved in this business for five years. Her primary customers are local customers. 

Joyce describes her biggest business challenge to be inflation. She will use the KES 70,000 loan to buy more household goods for resale, i.e., furniture and other items. Her business goal is to be a wholesaler and distributor within five years. This is her second loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: buy more household goods for resale, i.e., furniture and other items

loans.name: Juan Bautista

texts.es:
Juan, se le presenta la necesidad de optar por un nuevo préstamo porque requiere de más capital de trabajo para continuar invirtiendo en el cultivo de maíz y frijol; esta inversión le ayudara  a comprar los insumos agrícolas necesarios, tales como: abono, herbicidas, pesticidas, plaguicidas, insecticidas, entre otros.
El crédito anterior le ayudo a la adquisición de materiales agrícolas para el cultivo. Su sueño es terminar sus estudios universitarios y a apoyar a su familia.

loans.use: Para comprar  abono, herbicidas, pesticidas, plaguicidas, insecticidas, entre otros.

loans.name: Fortaleza Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “FORTALEZA”  iniciará el primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal Copacabana, está compuesta por ocho integrantes y esta dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Virginia es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de leche, venta de CD’s, carpintería, venta de queso, venta de ganado, venta de lanas, tejido de camas.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Virginia es integrante, ella indica que es la primera vez que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por invitación de una promotora de la institución que fue a visitarle a su casa. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de lechería; da a conocer que este negocio lo aprendió hace varios años atrás aprendiendo la técnica de su madre a quien le ayudaba desde niña.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de vaca lechera) que adquirirá de las ferias aledañas y posteriormente a la crianza lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para mantener en lo posible a su hogar pues ella es casada y tiene tres hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta la capacitación en salud y crédito.
texts.en:
The "Fortaleza" (Strength) Communal Bank will begin its first loan cycle with Pro Mujer as part of the Copacabana Community Center. It is made up of 8 members and run by a board of directors, of which Virginia is the president. The members of this communal bank carry out a variety of different businesses, such as selling milk, selling CD's, carpentry, selling cheese, selling livestock, selling wool and woven bedding.

Virginia is one of the female micro entrepreneurs who will benefit from the loan they will take out. She says that this is the first time she has been a part of Pro Mujer, joining at the invitation of a group promoter who came to visit her at her house. At present she has a dairy business that she says she learned several years ago, picking up the skills from her mother, whom she helped since childhood.
 
The loan she will take out now is for an increase in capital (the purchase of a dairy cow) that she will buy from the neighboring fairs and, after raising it, she'll sell it at her store. This type of work allows her to generate resources to support her household as much as possible since she is married and has three children.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer she responds that she likes the health training and the loan.

loans.use: to purchase a dairy cow.

loans.name: Maria Helena

texts.es:
María Elena es una mujer que vive por sus dos hijas las cuales son su gran motivación de salir adelante y piensa que estudiando y superándose es la mejor manera, le gusta la estética porque cree que viéndose linda por fuera se siente bien por dentro, además le gusta estudiar es apasionada por lo que hace, tiene dentro sus planes tener su propio negocio, manejar sus horarios tener mas tiempo para compartir con su familia y tener una mejor calidad de vida.
El poder entrar a una escuela le da pautas para empezar a subir el primer escalón y alcanzar sus metas, piensa que la edad no tiene ningún problema para llegar a su objetivo le gustaría mostrarle a sus hijas que nunca se es viejo para lograr sus sueños y que hay que esforzarse para ello, a María Elena le gusta ayudar a la gente y sabe que hay muchas personas que no les gusta su físico y por ello tienen problemas de autoestima y le gustaría desde el punto profesional poder ayudarlos.
Su más grande sueño es tener un centro holístico donde encuentren belleza integral, relajación y mucha espiritualidad donde pudiera ayudar a niños enfermos por medio de masajes hidroterapia a pasar ese trago tan amargo.
A nivel personal le gustaría tener una casa propia para asegurarles un mejor futuro a sus hijas que son el motor de sus vida ella tiene una adolescente de 15 años y una hermosa princesa de 4 años su hija mayor no tiene padre lo cual hace que ella se esfuerce mas por el futuro de su hija y a la cual le quiere mostrar que es mejor esforzarse por las metas y está convencida que hay que capacitarse y ver mas allá de lo que nos rodea. Para María Helena la familia es la gasolina que impulsa todo tipo de motor.
texts.en:
María Elena is a woman who lives for her two daughters, who are her main motivation to move forward.  She thinks that studying and succeeding is the best way to do that.  She likes esthetics because she believes that when you see yourself as beautiful on the outside, you feel good inside.  She likes to study esthetics because she is passionate about what she does.  She has plans to have her own business and manage her schedule so that she can have more time to share with her family and have a better quality of life.  Being able to enter a school gave her guidelines for how to take the first step and achieve her goals.  She thinks that age will not stop her from reaching her objective and she would like to show her daughters that you are never too old to achieve your dreams and you have to make an effort for them.  María Elena likes to help people and she knows that many people do not like their physical shape and have problems with self esteem and she would like to be at the professional level to be able to help them.

Her greatest dream is to have a holistic center that offers comprehensive beauty treatments, relaxation, and spirituality.  She also wants to help sick children with hydrotherapy massages since she has experienced that bitter experience.  On a personal level, she would like to own a home to be sure she can provide a better future for her daughters, since they are the driving force in her life.  She has a 15 year old teenager and a beautiful princess who is 4 years old.  Her older daughter does not have a father, which makes her make more of an effort for her future.  She wants to show her that it is better to work for your goals.  She is convinced that its important to get training and see farther than what is around us.  For María Helena, her family is the gasoline that drives everything.

loans.use: to enroll for one semester in a body esthetics course.

loans.name: Tamba Group

texts.en:
Pictured here are teachers of a secondary school located in Koidu, a city in eastern Sierra Leone. Together, they have come to SMT/Kiva lenders to request a loan of 11,500,000 leones for the entire team. With the help of this loan, they can meet their most immediate and most pressing financial needs. At the end of each month, they can easily repay the loan using their monthly salaries. It is their school’s bursar who is directly responsible for doing the deductions and making the repayments on their behalf.

Tamba is the featured leader of this group of teachers. Fifty-six-year-old Tamba is a native of Wordu, in eastern Sierra Leone. He is married to a housewife and the couple has two children who are attending secondary and tertiary institutions. Tamba has been a school teacher for 36 years now. He has requested this loan in order to pay school/college fees for his children. He will use the rest to buy house building materials, such as cement, for the construction of a dwelling house.

loans.use: to pay school/college fees for his children and to buy house building materials, such as cement, for the construction of a dwelling house

loans.name: Charles Group

texts.en:
Salone Microfinance Trust (SMT) is very pleased to present to you this group of primary school teachers located in Koidu, in eastern Sierra Leone. This group of teachers have come to SMT, a partner of Kiva.org to apply for a loan of SLL 23,400,000 for the entire team. With the help of this loan, they can meet their most immediate and pressing financial needs, and at the end of each month, they can easily repay the loan using their monthly salaries. It is their school’s bursar who is directly responsible for doing the deductions, and making the repayments on their behalf.

Charles is the featured leader of this group of teachers. A native of Lei Chiefdom in eastern Sierra Leone, 49-year-old Charles is married and has 2 children who are in college. Charles has been a school teacher for 10 years now. He has requested for this loan in order to pay college fees for his children.

loans.use: to pay college fees for his children.

loans.name: Menday K. Group

texts.en:
Salone Microfinance Trust (SMT), a partner of Kiva.org based in Makeni, northern Sierra Leone, is very pleased to present to you this group of teachers from Koidu, a city in eastern Sierra Leone. This group of teachers has come to SMT to apply for a loan of SLL 3,500,000.00 for the entire group. With the help of this loan, they are being empowered to meet their most immediate and most pressing financial challenges. And at the end of each month, they can easily repay the loan, using their monthly salaries. It is their school’s bursar who is directly responsible for doing the deductions and making the repayments on their behalf.

Menday is the featured leader of this group. He is 48 years of age. A native of Foregugu, in northern Sierra Leone, Menday is married to a head teacher and has been a school teacher, for 20 years. He has requested this loan in order to pay school fees for his children and will use the rest to buy houme building material like cement, nails etc. for the construction of a home for his family.

loans.use: to buy house building material like cement, nails etc to build a home for his family

loans.name: Awa's Group

texts.fr:
Créer le 14 janvier 1998, le banc villageois est composé de femmes très engagées dans le développement d’activités génératrices de revenus. Tous membres du groupement vivent dans le même quartier et entretiennent des relations séculaires  de bon voisinage. De plus elles ont en majorité une grande expérience du système des bancs villageois.

Madame Awa (assise) est la représentante de ce groupe. Elle est mariée et mère de 03 garçons et 04 filles. Malgré son âge avancé s’est une femme d’une détermination sans faille dans ses activités commerciales et ceux du banc villageois. Elle tient une table de légumes fraîches au marché central. En plus de collaboration avec son fils, elle fabrique et vend du savon traditionnel dans les villages et marchés hebdomadaires. 
  
Son nouveau prêt lui permettra d’acheter   les intrants entrant dans le processus de fabrication du savon en partie et faire des commandes aux femmes productrices de légumes. 

Elle compte avec les bénéfices elle compte agrandir son cheptel de montons et de chèvres  d’une part  et d’autre part améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille.
texts.en:
This Banc Villageois, which was created on January 14, 1998, is made up of women who are very involved in the development of income-generating activities.  All the group members live in the same neighborhood and have shared excellent neighbors' relationships with one another for a very long time.  Besides, most of them are very familiar with the Banc Villageois system.  

Awa, the only woman sitting in the photo, is the representative of this group.  She is married and the mother of three boys and four girls.  In spite of her age, she is a very determined woman who confidently manages her commercial activities and collaborates with the Banc Villageois.

Awa uses a table at the central market to display fresh vegetables.  Additionally, and in collaboration with her son, she produces traditional soap which she sells in villages and at weekly markets.

With her new loan, she will be able to buy the necessary ingredients  for the production of soap, and to place orders for vegetables with women producers. 

She is planning to use her profits to increase her headcount of sheep and goats, and also to improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for the production of soap and to place orders of vegetables with women producers.

loans.name: Koko

texts.fr: Agée de 38 ans Koko est  célibataire et habite dans le quartier de Bè. Elle  est coiffeuse et fait aussi la tresse il y a 15 ans. Ce crédit lui permet d’associer la vente de défrisant  et  de mèches à la coiffure ce qui lui permet d’attirer plus de clientes et augmenter ses revenus, pour se prendre en charge et aider les parents dans l’éducation de ses frères et sœurs.
texts.en: Koko is 38 years old and single. She lives in the "Bè" neighborhood. She is a hair stylist, and has also been doing hair braids for 15 years. With this loan, she can start selling hair relaxer and extensions. This will allow her to bring in more clients and grow her income so that she can take care of herself and help her parents with her brothers and sisters' education.

loans.use: buy 60 boxes of hair relaxer.

loans.name: Dufatanye Bategarugori Group

texts.fr:
Olive est membre du groupe DUFATANYE BATEGARUGORI, elle a 25 ans ,elle est mariée et a 3 enfants le plus âgé a 8 ans et le moins âgé a 4 ans. 2 de ses enfants vont à l`école.

Elle sollicite ce crédit pour payer le main d`oeuvre ,et louer le champs à cultiver

Elle n`attend aucune difficulté pour le remboursement. ses stratégies pour la croissance de l`affaire est de chercher le marche des ses produits et utiliser les angrais chimiques

Ses ambitions sont les suivant: avoir son champs à cultiver et Eduquer ses enfants.
texts.en:
Olive is a member of the Dufatanye Bategarugori group. She is 25 years old, married, and has 3 children between the ages of four and eight.

She is asking for a loan to pay for labor and to rent fields that she can plant. 

She does not foresee any problems with the repayment of her loan. Her growth strategy for her business is to find the market for her goods and to use  chemical fertilizer.

Her ambitions are as follows: having a field to cultivate and educate her children.

loans.use: pay for labor.

loans.name: Maritza  Johana

texts.es:
Maritza Johana  es una madre soltera con una niña, quien por el fallecimiento de su madre también tiene a cargo  a sus dos hermanos menores. Ella quiere terminar sus estudios de enfermería pues su proyecto es poder tener los recursos necesarios para poder brindarle a su hija una buena educación,  empezando desde su corta edad y poder contribuir para que sus dos hermanos menores puedan tener una educación especial de acuerdo a la incapacidad que ellos sufren, brindándoles asi la oportunidad de que aprendan algún arte para que se puedan defender en un futuro.
Ella quiere una vez terminada su carrera hacer un voluntariado enfocándose en niños y/o ancianos, pues su propósito es tener la satisfacción de ayudar a otras personas  y poderle enseñar a su hija el gusto de servir a los demás. 
Su anhelo es dejarle a su hija buenas bases morales pero también económicas y no dejarla totalmente desprotegida si algún día llegase a faltar, para esto una de sus metas son tener una microempresa de productos agrícolas sin dejar de ejercer su principal pasión que es la enfermería pero que este aporte económico que brinda esta profesión sea una contribución para levantar esta microempresa.
texts.en:
Maritza Johana’s a single mother of a girl but because of her mother’s death she’s also caring for her two younger siblings.  She wants to complete her nursing course because her project is to have the necessary resources to provide a good education for her daughter starting at a very young age and to be able to contribute so that her two younger siblings can get special education tailored to the disability they have thus providing them the opportunity to study some art so that they can fend for themselves in future.

Once she completes her studies she wants to do some volunteer work focused on children and/or older people because her goal is to have the satisfaction of helping others and to instill in her daughter the joy of serving others.

Her dream is to instill in her daughter not only good moral bases but also economic ones so that she will not be left unprotected if she herself should someday no longer be here.  This is why one of her goals is to have an agricultural supplies micro business while not leaving aside her passion for nursing so that the income this profession produces will contribute towards this micro business’ establishment.

loans.use: with her studies at Campoalto.

loans.name: Arceli

texts.en:
Araceli is 67 years old and widowed. She has a business buying and selling mud crabs and lobsters in the Philippines and earns additional income from raising pigs and water buffalo and farming rice. Aracel is borrowing 15,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) through NWTF to buy more mud crabs and lobsters for resale. She successfully paid back her previous loan and has now requested a new loan to further build and expand her businesses.

Araceli has been sustaining her business activities through 10 prior loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more crabs and lobsters for resale

loans.name: Botomabakouwe

texts.fr: En 1998, madame Botomabakouwe a démarré son activité de vente de charbons de bois, de mais et du miel sous un hangar. Elle exerce seule cette activité et sollicite son premier crédit à WAGES pour approvisionner en marchandises. Elle espère épargner et avoir une famille financièrement stable. Elle est mariée et mère de 02 enfants(20 et 16ans) scolarisés. Elle est quant à elle âgée de 47ans.
texts.en: In 1998 Botomabakouwe started selling charcoal, corn and honey in a shed. She works alone, and has asked for her first loan from WAGES to buy supplies. She hopes to be able to save, as well as to provide financial security for her family. Botomabakouwe is 47 years of age, married, and has two children at school (aged 20 and 16).

loans.use: To buy charcoal, corn and honey.

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John is 37 years old and lives in the town of Matugga in the Luwero region of Uganda. He is married and has five children with four of them currently in school. For the past nine years, John has been working hard to manage his poultry farm. 

To help expand his business, John has requested a loan of 3,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more feed that will increase the quality of the eggs from the chickens, and will help John to generate greater profits and educate his children up to the higher level. John hopes that in the future he will be able to buy an incubator. 

John is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like John who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to purchase more feed that will increase the quality of the eggs

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase corn by the hundredweight and lime.

loans.name: Mizuka Youth Group

texts.en:
Mizuka Youth Group is composed of young people who are passionate about football. Upon winning numerous local trophies the youth decided to embark on economic activities that will make them self sufficient. As a result they started growing and selling vegetables, distributing water and movie screening.

Antony on the far left has a passion for football and he is married with one child. His desire is to see football players having decent living after their professional career is over and he believes that is possible through entrepreneurship. Last year, the group successfully completed a Junior Achievement entrepreneurship program where the program build their capability of growing and expanding their businesses. Upon graduation the group carried out market research and observed the demand for rabbit meat within their community.

Antony hopes to take a loan to start a rabbit rearing business which will supplement the group's vegetable and water business and will increase their realized income.

loans.use: The group will use the loan to purchase materials required to build a rabbit rearing unit and rabbits to establish the business.

loans.name: Jitahidi Youth Group

texts.en:
Jitahidi Youth Group was formed when a group of young people who were in the business of garbage collection decided to come together to provide socio-economic support to each other. As a result, the group established a merry-go round where they would provide micro loans and emergency loans to its members.

Joseph on the far right is a single father raising a child with the help of his parents. He has successfully completed training on life skills and he hopes to use the loan in starting poultry business. The Group was identified by Junior Achievement and they are currently undergoing an entrepreneurship program with the objective of building their capacity to grow and expand their businesses. The group through market research has seen the opportunity of selling eggs and chicken in the community and have already constructed a brooder for their venture.

Through mentorship from Junior Achievement the group will be able to embark on poultry business and be successful given the need for the product and the newly acquired business skills that the members of the group have.

loans.use: The loan will be used to buy the chicks and the feed for the chicks to start an extended poulty business.

loans.name: Grandiam Group

texts.en:
Grandiam is made up of young people who are passionate about entrepreneurship. The youth met during the time they created and managed their own business with the support of Junior Achievement and were recognized as the second best youth led business nationally.

Upon realizing this fete, the team was given extended business by their school to supply the students with scarfs that marched the school uniforms and pillows for comfortable sleeping. This venture has been very successful and thus the request for a loan to grow and expand it.

loans.use: The loan will be used to buy the materials for making outfits for the clothing busiiness.

loans.name: Aisha

texts.en:
Aisha  is 32 years old and lives in the town of Zana in the Kampala west region of Uganda. She is a widow and has 5 children 2 of them are currently in school. For the past 6 years, Aisha  has been working hard to manage her business selling charcoal. 

To help expand her business, Aisha  has requested a loan of 2,500,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more charcoal to sell, and will help Aisha  to generate greater profits and to construct a big place for charcoal selling. Aisha hopes that in the future she will be able to construct rental houses. 

Aisha is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Aisha  who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy more charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Bassiratou

texts.fr: Revendeuse de palettes, Bassiratou sollicite un premier crédit pour acheter plus de marchandises. Mariée, elle a 03 enfants âgés de 10,07 et 02ans. Elle espère assurer la scolarité de ses enfants avec le profit et faire plus de chiffre d'affaire.
texts.en: Bassiratou, who is a pallet retailer, requests a first loan to purchase more stock. She is married with three children aged ten, seven, and two. With the profits she hopes to pay for her children’s school fees and make a better income.

loans.use: To buy pallets.

loans.name: Milka

texts.en:
Milka is a 57-year-old married woman. She has five children with ages ranging from 18 to 30 years old. Milka describes herself as patient. She operates a farm where she keeps dairy cows, chicken, and also does farming. She has been involved in this business for 10 years. Her primary customers are local residents. She describes her biggest business challenge as animal diseases. 

Milka will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy animal feed and other items to boost business. Her business goal is to have a wholesale business within five years. This is her first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy animal feed and other items to boost business

loans.name: Lina Marcela

texts.es:
Lina Marcela una mujer de 18 años, vive cada segundo de la vida, todos la conocen por su sonrisa que la caracteriza al igual que su preguntadera porque todo lo quiere saber pero muy poco responder. Una persona que detalla la vida y aprende de ella, pues la vida le enseñó a que el pasado nos ayuda a no cometer los mismos errores o mejorar cosas en el presente; claro está que de los errores se aprende y hay que caer para poderse levantar aun con mas fuerzas.
Esta mujer tiene varias aspiraciones para su vida y tiene como proyecto de vida ser una profesional en su carrera, trabajo pero sobre todo como persona, que quiere sobresalir por sus conocimientos ante los demás hacer sentir orgullosa a su madre quien además de darle la vida es una mujer de admirar, quien le ha enseñado a sus hijas el verdadero significado de la unión familiar y de superar los obstáculos siempre teniendo aspiraciones, sueños, metas, de jamás dejar de estudiar de llenarse de conocimiento de experiencias vividas, conocer el mundo conocer a las personas y aprender de ellas.
Lina es una niña alegre, responsable, sencilla de pensamiento abierto, hiperactiva, ágil, jamás se queda quieta siempre da más de lo que le piden, solo pide una oportunidad más para seguir estudiando y seguir creciendo como persona y profesional.
texts.en:
Lina Marcela, 18, lives every second of life.  Everyone knows her for her characteristic smile as well as for all the questions she asks, because she wants to know everything but not respond to anything.  She's a person who explains life and learns from it.  Life has taught her that the past helps us to not make the same mistakes, or to improve things in the present.  It's true, we learn from our mistakes and it's necessary to fall to be able to get back up with even more strength.

This woman has several goals in life.  Her life project is to be a professional in her field, in her work but above all as a person who wants to stand out in the eyes of others because of her knowledge.  

Lina wants to make her mother proud.  Her mother, in addition to giving her life, is a woman to admire.  She taught her daughters the true meaning of family unity; of overcoming obstacles; of always having aspirations, dreams, and goals; of never stopping studying; of filling themselves with knowledge and lived experiences; of knowing the world and people and learning from them.

Lina's a happy, responsible, modest girl.  She's open minded, hyperactive, and flexible.  She's never still.  She always gives more than she's asked to.  She asks only for another opportunity to continue studying and growing as a person and as a professional.

loans.use: to get a technical education in graphic arts and advertising

loans.name: Domingo Gonzalo

texts.es: Domingo es un hombre emprendedor de 54 años de edad, acompañado, con dos hijos de 18 y 16 años, su negocio es un cafetín  desde hace 13 años. Tiene de ser cliente de la institución 8 años, tiempo en el cual ha demostrado ser muy responsable y cumplido. El crédito lo requiere para hacer mejoras en el cafetin como compra de zinc, bloques, hierro, alambre para amarre de hierro, estribos, cemento, arena, piedrin, etc.
texts.en: Domingo is an enterprising man of 54 years. He is in a relationship and has two children, who are 18 and 16 years old. His business is a snack bar, which he has had for 13 years. He has been a client of the institution for 8 years and through this time has proven to be very responsible and reliable. He needs the loan to make improvements to his snack bar, such as the purchase of zinc, cement blocks, rebar and wire, supports, cement, sand, gravel, etc.

loans.use: to make improvements to his snack bar.

loans.name: Salome Sandrine
